programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James hopes to sell a Second World War Tiger Moth biplane for £70,000, while two different diamond rings bought for £22,000 give the Prestige Pawnbrokers team a headache. Plus, a lord and lady try to sell some luxury handbags and a guitar signed by members of the Rolling Stones.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James has two days to turn around a £100,000 loan on a sapphire and diamond ring, while a former fashionista approaches Claudia about her designer handbag collection. A yoga devotee wants a loan on items from her past so she can invest in the future, and James has to make a snap decision on an Italian classic scooter.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer try to solve the problems of first-time buyers in north London. Kirstie tries to end the house-hunting misery of Ify Okoye, who has viewed 90 properties without success. Meanwhile, Phil assists a couple looking to settle down in England after six years abroad - but discovers their ambitions may put their budget under serious strain.(n)

programme.title: Double Your House for Half the Money
programme.sub-title: Sarah Beeny's Double Your House for Half the Money.
programme.desc: On the Sussex coast, Sarah meets Paul and Ryan, who dream of a modern, stylish home with spectacular views of the sea. Unfortunately the only house they could afford is a small bungalow - with no views at all. The couple plan to create the ideal property themselves using their life savings, including a cutting-edge kitchen and a whole new floor. But will design headaches, heated debates, budgetary restraints and the worst storms in a decade derail the project? Plus, in the Buckinghamshire village of Great Missenden, Drachan and Susan want to transform their drab 1950s house.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to La Tavola Calda in Nuneaton, where father and son team Mick and Chris Emanuele run a basic B&B above their Italian restaurant.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former property developer Ian hosts the first dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping his super-healthy menu will win him the £1,000 prize - although it is possible his guests may be more impressed with his 12-bedroom mansion in the country. Some naked antics, a pinata and stories of millions pounds won and lost make it a night to remember.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Reigning Miss Cheltenham Sophie hosts the second dinner party in Gloucestershire, hoping her evening of elegant food and pageantry will win her the £1,000 prize. The 24-year-old reveals what she does for a living to her guests, and one attendee makes a surprising confession of her own.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rugby-loving Carmel hosts the third dinner party in Gloucestershire, and she hopes to impress with a `Six Nations' starter, a pancetta, king prawn and chorizo main, and a Key lime pie for dessert. An attempt to charm her guests backfires when she likens Ian to a psychotic killer, and the atmosphere takes a further knock after Chris gets on the wrong side of Sophie.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: School teacher Polly, 40, hosts the fourth night of the competition in Gloucestershire, and hopes to impress her guests with a fine-dining experience. She begins with a seafood starter before serving up a meaty main course, and isn't unnerved by the fact she hasn't had any practise cooking either dish. However, her guests show off round the table and threaten to take the attention away from the night, but Ian is highly impressed with Polly's choice of entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the turn of exuberant hair salon owner Chris to host the final dinner party in Gloucestershire with home-made treats on the menu, including a tiger prawn starter, venison for the main and a dessert of chocolate and walnut ice-cream. Chat around the table reveals some differing opinions after the guests make a discovery in the host's living room, and the group reflect on their time together before the winner of the cash prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples hoping to relocate to Surrey. Sonia and Daniel Alderson-Smith have a sizeable budget to find a new property in East Molesey - but have also decided there are only 18 streets on which they will consider living. Meanwhile, Phil offers advice to Maeve and Peter Dunne, who are unsure about which part of the county to move to.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps Martyn and Anne Golesworthy find a holiday home on the Greek island of Naxos, which holds a special place in their hearts as the place they got married.(n)

programme.title: Child Genius
programme.desc: New series. Richard Osman returns with the competition to find the nation's brightest child, with 20 of the country's cleverest eight to 12-year-olds - and their parents - battling it out for the title. Broadcast over six consecutive evenings, the contest opens with the demanding Spelling and complex Linguistic Memory rounds - testing the participants on their recall of the Latin and Greek-derived scientific names of 60 fruit and vegetables, with three kids having to leave the tournament after these two challenges.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp try to help a couple living in a flat on the River Thames in central London, who disagree on whether they should move. Gareth and Tina have owned the property for 10 years and Tina loves being within walking distance of work, schools, clubs and all the sights, but Gareth wants a big family home and Phil finds a detached house with a pool to tempt the family into the suburbs.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Examining what happens when members of the public act as judge and jury, and carry out their own retribution. In Wiltshire, PCs John Miller and Hannah Agate pursue and catch two men who have threatened to kill someone who they believe has attacked a person they know, and in Trowbridge, a supermarket security guard's attempts to stop a shoplifter stealing alcohol has tragic consequences.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 22-year-old gym addict Sophie from Surrey, who is desperate to find a man who boasts a little banter. Next up is Dom, a 25-year-old wedding model from Bournemouth. He wants to find the perfect man to waltz him down the aisle and thinks people that can guarantee to do this are confident, daring and adventurous in their outlook.(n)

programme.title: Flights from Hell: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the extremes of human behaviour in airports and on planes. Footage includes angry missed check-ins to bizarre drunken antics at security, alternative safety briefings, deafening party flights and near-death experiences on flights from hell.(n)

programme.title: Child Genius
programme.desc: Day two of the week-long competition as some of the country's cleverest eight to 12 year olds battle for the title of Britain's brightest child. Led by quizmaster Richard Osman, the remaining 17 competitors first face an exacting maths round - testing both written and mental arithmetic. There is also a complex memory round before 13 children proceed to the next stage.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous words-and-numbers quiz, with regular team captain Sean Lock and guest captain Sarah Millican joined by Roisin Conaty and Rhod Gilbert. David O'Doherty presides alongside Countdown regular Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Micha and Crispin's beloved Bengal cat Loki has been hit by a car, while Faberge, an elderly Chinese crested dog with a fabulous wardrobe, is brought in by owners Julie and Suzanne after suffering seizures. Noel Fitzpatrick and the team also meet a deerhound called Willow, who has broken her neck, and with a high-risk operation to consider, her owners must decide whether to proceed.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Couples from Portsmouth and the Isle of Wight compete, as Maddi and Givon host a night of fine champagne and fusion food, and Ali and John cook a menu they have never made before.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnshop boss James test drives a home-made electric bike, while the Prestige Pawnbrokers team are put to the test when a £30,000 diamond ring arrives with the wrong paperwork. Meanwhile, a bespoke DJ van comes to HQ with a large price tag, and a bishop wants to sell a Salvador Dali sculpture to fund his children's charity in Kenya.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou and the team receive a visit from a former Chelsea footballer who has brought along some expensive watches. James is also put to the test when asked to evaluate a hovercraft from a Bond film, and an unusual painting of Saddam Hussein causes a stir in the office. Also, there's a big surprise for a mother looking to sell some spectacular jewellery to help her son's business venture.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer visit the Tees Valley in the north-east of England to find a property for first-time parents Nicola Moore and Tony Curry, who are desperate for a place together. They also offer expert advice to jewellery designer Emily Lathan and her graphic-designer boyfriend Dani Jones.(n)

programme.title: Double Your House for Half the Money
programme.sub-title: Sarah Beeny's Double Your House for Half the Money.
programme.desc: Tabitha and Paul Rawlinson want to double the size of their small country cottage in Kent, and creating more space for their young family is high on the list of priorities, but blending the old with the new is the dream. With both an extension and restoration project on their hands, the couple face a challenging build. Sarah also meets Jim and Elaine who are looking to update their uninspiring 1960s semi to make room for their growing family. The problem is, they only have a tiny budget and a very specific timescale.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Los Angeles to help La Frite, an outdated French restaurant that is failing to make any profits. His first step is to try to reconcile the feuding family members who run the business, and so devises a plan to bring them together by using secret filming.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Lansdowne in the Cotswolds for the third day of the contest, where Janie and Gemma like the rooms, but Mick and Chris are determined to find fault.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition heads to Milton Keynes, where first to host is 52-year old hypnotherapist Howard, who is hoping his fancy menu will go down with his guests. However, with dishes including `red treacle tart' his visitors are unsure what to expect, and not everyone shares the thrill when Howard introduces his `Pendulum of Truth' to the proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Louise hosts the second night in Milton Keynes, where she hopes to wow her guests with her `fabulous' menu - including bruschetta and mousse. However, the outspoken PA receives criticism from her guests - will she be able to overcome it to secure the prize?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Management consultant David hosts the third dinner party in Milton Keynes, and his guests are impressed when he introduces some dancing Las Vegas showgirls. However, with all his focus on entertainment, David makes a major blunder with the food and serves vegetarian Helen a meat dish.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer services manager and vegeterian Helen hosts the fourth night of the competition in Milton Keynes, Buckinghamshire, and hopes that an East meets West-themed night will win her the £1,000 prize. Hypnotherapist Howard is intrigued by some items he finds in her bedroom, while salesman Simon enjoys her entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final evening in Milton Keynes and the dinner party is thrown by salesman Simon, who believes that his night of fine dining will impress the critical guests. However, things begin to go awry when Howard embarks on a mission to throw his plans off course, and Helen discovers a collection of awards that evidence the host's competitive nature. Meanwhile, Louise finally comes clean about her dislike of David, before the votes are cast and the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit their oldest-ever house-hunters, Margot and Henry from Berkshire, who were looking to move to somewhere a little more modern after 50 years in the same place. They also catch up with young couple Wendy and Simon, who were desperate to find their first home in Derby.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows Southampton couple David and Sonia five fantastic properties for their budget of £100,000 in the Almeria province of southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: Child Genius
programme.desc: Day two of the week-long competition as some of the country's cleverest eight to 12 year olds battle for the title of Britain's brightest child. programme.title: Princess Diana's `Wicked' Stepmother
programme.desc: An examination of the turbulent relationship between Diana, Princess of Wales and her formidable stepmother Raine Spencer, who rose from humble origins with the help of her larger-than-life mother, the novelist Barbara Cartland, to become a countess and a member of the royal family. Raine was a divisive figure, who was doted on by her husband Johnnie Spencer but loathed by Diana and her siblings. Yet as the princess's marriage collapsed, she reached out to her stepmother for support, marking a change in the women's relationship.(n)

programme.title: How to Get a Council House
programme.desc: The return of the documentary looking at how local authorities deal with a lack of properties and a growing number of people in need of homes at affordable rents, this time going behind the scenes with council officers in Portsmouth. A former naval engineer turns to Portsmouth City Council's housing office for help, having been homeless for nearly two years after the sudden death of his son led to alcoholism, the breakdown of his marriage and, finally, to life on the streets.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: Estate agency owner Jeremy and his wife are on the trail of a tenant who left their property in Hull with more than £1,000 worth of damage, and to add insult to injury, the landlord's curtains are also missing. Meanwhile in Grimsby, a letting agent receives a pleasant surprise when he finds a tenant has cleaned up mess at his property as promised, but will he pay up his rent arrears of more than £3,000? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: William The Exorcist Friedkin's horror film stars Ashley Judd as Agnes, a waitress in a run-down bar who lives in a cheap motel. Into her life comes drifter Peter who, having served in the Gulf war, is obsessed with the idea that he is infected by bugs implanted by the government during medical treatment. She begins to share his paranoia and the pair spiral into a violent conspiracy theory which sees them become violently delusional to the point of extreme self-harm as they battle the bugs they believe are within them. Based on Tracy Letts' play from Chicago's Steppenwolf theatre, this is a visceral, frightening film but one that maintains an empathy for its characters up to the apocalyptic finale(n)

programme.title: The Omen
programme.desc: After his wife gives birth to a stillborn child, the American ambassador to Britain switches two kids in their hospital cribs. What he doesn't know is that little Damien is the Anti-Christ(n)

programme.title: Daredevil

With the help of Elektra, Murdock takes on mob boss Kingpin and his hired assassin Bullseye(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny

programme.title: Joy

programme.title: Brooklyn

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: In Alexander Payne's bittersweet comedy, two buddies, Miles and Jack, embark on Jack's stag week, a tasting trip around California's wine country, with oenophile Miles leading the way. Miles may be a wine expert but he's also a bitter divorcee, depressed and in love with a waitress, Maya, whose presence always leaves him tongue-tied. Jack is a faded actor who can't quite resign himself to marriage when there are still obtainable women in the world, married or not, and when he meets Stephanie at a tasting, he swears Miles to secrecy about the wedding. and so the foursome continue their trip... Alexander Payne's Oscar and BAFTA-winning road trip is a classic of friendship and crisis, with four outstanding leads(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: Best friends Liv and Emma discover their dream weddings have been booked at the same venue on the same date and an epic catfight ensues. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: Comedian Cedric the Entertainer serves as both producer and star of this comedy about a family who discovers just how much can go wrong en route to a family get-together. When Nate Johnson (Cedric the Entertainer) is invited to a big family reunion in Missouri, he sees it as an opportunity to reconnect with his estranged wife and growing children, as well as a chance to show up his wealthier know-it-all brother, Mack (Steve Harvey). Nate takes delivery on an expensive new SUV, persuades his recently separated wife, Dorothy (Vanessa L. Williams), to tag along, and packs up his three kids -- nubile teenager Nikki (Solange Knowles), under-age wannabe rapper D.J. (Bow Wow), and precocious seven-year-old Destiny (Gabby Soleil) -- for what he imagines will be a leisurely drive from Los Angeles to St. Louis. However, between his wary wife, arguing kids, angry police officers, bizarre hitchhikers, bad diner food, and an unfortunate run-in with a cement mixer, getting from point A to point B proves to be just short of a nightmare. Johnson Family Vacation was the first feature film for director Christopher Erskin, who previously distinguished himself directing music videos for the likes of Missy Elliot, TLC, and Boyz II Men(n)

Soon, he and his men are cornered in a tiny area by more than 2,000 Viet-Cong and engaged in a fight to the death. Randall Wallace's visceral film also stars Greg Kinnear, Barry Pepper and Marc Blucas(n)

Now an experiment is underway to do just this - until the little girl at the heart of the experiment breaks out of the laboratory and goes on the run. In present-day London, 12-year-old Quinn Abercromby witnesses the awakening of a hibernating dragon from a centuries-long slumber, the result of a construction dig supervised by his mother and an incident for which Quinn feels partially responsible. Twenty years later, the adult Quinn is the fire chief of a refortified castle community, responsible for dousing the blazes lit by the dragon's prodigious number of flame-spewing offspring, airborne juggernauts that have wreaked havoc across the globe, torching civilization and turning humans into an endangered species. Hope arrives in the form of Denton "Dragon Slayer" Van Zan, an American known to be the only man to ever kill one of the dragons, and Alex Jenson, a scientist/pilot who's a member of Van Zan's army, a zealous fighting force that includes a secret weapon: the Archangels, paratroopers using themselves as bait to attract and then dispatch the deadly beasts(n)

programme.title: Lair of the Killer Crocs
programme.desc: A journey to Australia to observe saltwater crocodiles in the Northern Territory is undertaken by Paul Bedard and Mick Pitman(n)

programme.title: World's Scariest Animal Attacks
programme.desc: Documentary taking viewers into the jaws of the most terrifying animal encounters ever captured on camera, with unprecedented access to the heart of the action and astonishing witness testimony. Shocking, scary and mesmerising, these sequences were filmed by ordinary people as they happened. Includes a lion attack at an awards ceremony, a shark biting open a diving cage, a bull loose in a packed crowd and a circus elephant going berserk(n)

programme.title: Monster Squid: The Giant Is Real
programme.desc: A giant squid is observed in its natural habitat(n)

programme.title: I Was Prey
programme.desc: Invisible Assassin. A diver is filming underwater at the Great Barrier Reef when he's stung by an Irukandji jellyfish; a forester is attacked by a grizzly bear in a rain forest(n)

programme.title: Monster Squid: The Giant Is Real

programme.title: Monster Squid: The Giant Is Real

programme.title: Bad Dog!

programme.sub-title: Ocicat, Norwegian Forest Cat, Selkirk Rex, Abyssinian, Bombay, Havana Brown
programme.desc: Ocicat, Norwegian Forest Cat, Selkirk Rex, Abyssinian, Bombay, Havana Brown. Which is the only cat breed named after a person? Which cat is nicknamed the 'parlour panther'? Find out the answers to these questions and more(n)

programme.title: Too Cute!
programme.desc: Spotted, Pampered Pups. A shy Cavalier King Charles spaniel is coaxed out of her shell. And three dalmatians grow into their spots as they show off their skills at a fire station(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Philadelphia
programme.desc: House of Horrors. Pennsylvania SPCA officers respond to a call concerning some abandoned animals, but nothing can prepare them for what they discover inside a kitchen fridge!(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops: Philadelphia
programme.desc: Bones. When Philadelphia police uncover a massive dog-fighting operation, the Pennsylvania SPCA is called in to investigate, leading to a grisly exhumation in a front yard(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Storm Surge. Hurricane Isaac in August 2012 creates havoc in New Orleans and poses new dangers for Villalobos, especially when the evacuation location floods(n)

programme.title: Pit Bulls & Parolees
programme.desc: Season 4 Unleashed. A look at the season's memorable moments, including rescues, adoptions and arguments with parolees. Also: updates on featured dogs(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The Hoff Gets a Tank. In the season premiere, actor David Hasselhoff wants an aquarium that recalls his time on "Baywatch" and "Knight Rider," and the job includes an inspirational trip to the Aquarium of the Pacific in Long Beach, Cal(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Dining with the Fishes. A table tank is built when Brett and Wayde team up with a dinnerware company for a trade show in Las Vegas; a seafood restaurant wants an aquarium that looks like a crab boat(n)

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Fish-a-Palooza. Brett and Wayde reveal incredible information about the fish that customers and fans ask them about the most, and let you in on some never before seen moments(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Adventure Headquarters. A thrill-seeking couple want a headquarters for their adventures that sits 16 feet high in three cedars and features a wraparound deck for views from all sides(n)

programme.desc: Treehouse Treehab. Pete is going back to where it all began with the first tree house he ever built, and another from the early days of his business. While there's nothing wrong with a classic, it's time to upgrade and update these early creations(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Country Superstar Speakeasy. Brian Kelley asks Pete to construct a treehouse with a vintage country twist perched above a steep ravine. Will Pete deliver a chart-topping creation?(n)

programme.title: Treehouse Masters: Branched Out
programme.desc: Family Trees. Charlie creates a new home on the family property where he can live full-time; Pete presents a housewarming gift to his daughter and her boyfriend by disassembling a structure from the family's TreeHouse Point bed-and-breakfast(n)

programme.desc: Greg and Jenni Wallen spend a trial week living in Auckland, New Zealand, with Greg keen to return to the country he fell in love with while backpacking.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of properties in Chesterton, Staffordshire, Bestwood in Nottingham, and Strawberry Hill, London.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search for relatives of an East London lady reveals a family connection to the most famous heist of the 20th century, and one heir hunter takes on much larger firms in Cheshire.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Alex Jones reports on a 15-year-old-girl who plunges 200 ft down a cliff face, and a Royal Navy winchman who repeatedly risks his own life to rescue six fishermen in stormy seas.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Newark International Antiques and Collectors Fair in Nottinghamshire, experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper help two teams pick up items to sell for profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Returning to the night of the murder, Brian's killer is revealed, while Nikki's new evidence leads to an inevitably sensitive visit.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which 30 recurring players compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a retired Manchester couple looking to move to rural Norfolk on a budget of £400,000, and finds out what it takes to keep England's historic houses running.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ben's joy at being given the Arches is short-lived when he learns that the car lot land is worth more, making him wonder if Phil values Jay more than him. Carmel hosts a dinner for Max and her sons, but things do not run smoothly when Shakil refuses to engage and Kush remains doubtful of his mother's boyfriend. Linda continues to regain control of the Vic, telling a frustrated Fi she has offered Tracey her job back, and Sonia offers to take Mr Pryce out for a drink.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Guy requests Oliver's help with a patient, hoping to foster support for a new research proposal. Sacha's rabbi is taken seriously ill, prompting a final reckoning over his belief in God. Meanwhile, Nina questions Matteo's feelings for her after they return from a not-so-romantic weekend away.(n)

programme.title: Trust Me
programme.desc: Deeply buried in her stolen identity, Ally, aka Cath, finds herself falling for Andy. When he gets a visit from Mike, an old friend who remembers Ms Sutton from their university days, Cath's reaction arouses suspicion, and may lead to her dark secret being exposed. Meanwhile, Brigitte decides to emotionally blackmail Ally. Drama, starring Jodie Whittaker and Emun Elliott.(n)

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens the 16-year-old case of an infamous getaway driver convicted of murdering his wife when new evidence suggests it could have been a miscarriage of justice. But Gerry, who was on the original investigation, refuses to believe the prisoner is anything but guilty. Meanwhile, Brian is in a reflective mood, convinced his days at Ucos are numbered after his actions against former police commander Embleton. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star as the veteran coppers, with Amanda Redman as their boss.(n)

programme.title: Scotland's Model Teenager
programme.desc: Documentary following the story of 18-year-old Glaswegian Connor Newall as he travels in Europe and to New York on various modelling assignments, examining his fast-paced life in the fashion world and also looking at whether his home life in Govan is moving on without him. Agents, family and professionals provide guidance as the teenage model tries to keep the momentum going and survive and thrive in the sometimes superficial world of fashion. Part of the Our Lives strand.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Kelly and her partner Gary spend a trial week living in Perth, with Kelly hoping to persuade her partner to relocate from their home in Caerphilly.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin meet the new owners of houses in Croydon in Surrey, the West Midlands city of Coventry and Nuttall in Nottinghamshire.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team search for the relatives of a well-loved Leicestershire lady, and on another case the heir hunters learn how the industrial revolution impacted Victorian bakeries.(n)

programme.title: Close Calls: On Camera
programme.desc: Near misses caught on CCTV, featuring holiday horror for a teenage brother and sister when their parasail detaches from the tow boat and heads for a power cable. Plus, a children's author who is nearly trampled to death by cows while viewing a country property.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two husband-and-wife teams compete in Hay-on-Wye, Powys, with help from Paul Laidlaw and Kate Bliss, while presenter Natasha Raskin examines an antique from the Jacobean period.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Stung by criticism, Nikki's success feels hollow, while Paudge is told a guilty secret, and Katie and David attempt to avoid Patricia's interference.(n)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts a game show in which 30 recurring players compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single `impossible' answer knocking them out for the day.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Looking to put their family first, Ginny Buckley takes a couple from Harrogate on a property search in Gloucestershire with a budget of £650,000.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, the 17th-century Palladian house owned by the Marquess of Hertford, antiques experts Charlie Ross and Will Axon find great treasures brought by visitors including an interesting busby hat. Will gets a surprise when a Worcester coffee set goes under the hammer, and presenter Paul Martin explores the Battle of Edgehill.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker hosts the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: An investigation into fake taxis that changed one woman's life forever and are putting thousands of passengers in danger. Plus, reports on the fake celebrity endorsements that tempt shoppers into spending and losing hundreds of pounds, and counterfeit cameras on sale that are not what they seem. Presented by Matt Allwright.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: New series. The culinary contest returns with Angellica Bell, Stephen Hendry, Julia Somerville, Henri Leconte and Jim Moir - AKA Vic Reeves - creating dishes for John Torode and Gregg Wallace. The celebrities undertake three culinary challenges, first tackling the Mystery Box, before splitting into groups to prepare dishes for paying customers. Finally, the contestants are tasked to prepare a two-course menu of their own design. The second programme is on Friday.(n)

programme.title: My Family, Partition and Me: India 1947
programme.desc: Part two of two. Anita Rani begins her own Partition journey, as she and her mother Lucky become the first members of her family to return to see what is now Pakistan, since the Partition of India. In the Punjabi village where her Sikh grandfather's first family were slaughtered, Anita meets locals who were eye witnesses to the terrible event. Across the border, Sameer Butt re-traces the epic train journey across the Punjab to Pakistan, and Binita Kane explores how her Hindu family managed to escape the violence that engulfed their Bengali village.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: New series. Sue Barker asks the questions in the quiz, with WBC Cruiserweight champion Tony Bellew, Ryder Cup golfer Andy Sullivan, cyclist Jess Varnish and Warrington Wolves' Ashton Sims joining team captains Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell.(n)

programme.title: Live from the BBC
programme.desc: New series. Hilariously honest stand-up about love, sex and modern living, with Sara Pascoe.(n)

programme.title: Anne Robinson's Britain
programme.sub-title: Britain's Relationship Secrets with Anne Robinson.
programme.desc: The broadcaster looks at the ingredients of a happy relationship, meeting five couples from very different backgrounds who think they have the answer. She finds out how one pair survived an affair, whether marrying the lord of the manor is all it's cracked up to be and if agreeing to an arranged marriage can hold the key to long-term happiness. She also gets two couples to delve into one another's relationships to see what they can learn.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Sports broadcaster Hazel Irvine joins host Brian Conley to recall her formative moments in front of the small screen. Clips include the 1972 Munich Olympic Games, which hold a mixture of celebratory and tragic memories, and the sports magazine programme Grandstand. Plus, Hazel reveals how Holiday reporter Anne Gregg helped influence the resorts she would visit. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Ben Cooper and Gary Pe help two teams find items at Peterborough's East of England Showground, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp tries her hand at glass-blowing in Stourbridge.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A woman has an emotional reunion with her niece after being estranged for 30 years, while another case reveals links to 19th-century Whitechapel and the Jack the Ripper murders.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Five groups of dedicated farmers from across the country are up against each other as they try to win the prestigious Against the Odds category at the British Farming Awards.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Scotland chefs hope to impress with their main dishes. Angela Malik prepares a tiffin box featuring a summer biriyani, quail scotch egg and spiced quail breasts, while Michael Bremner takes a huge risk by using ox tongue as the centrepiece of his main. Ally McGrath devises an inventive take on the summer barbecue, using a new method of cooking potatoes to recreate the coals.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents a quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the Super 8s and Qualifiers, including Salford Red Devils v Castleford Tigers, St Helens v Hull FC and Leigh Centurions v Hull Kingston Rovers.(n)

programme.title: I Bought a Rainforest
programme.desc: Four months on from his arrival in Peru and Charlie Hamilton James's grand scheme has hit the buffers, with squatter Elias constantly delaying his departure. His wife Philippa Forrester flies out from England to raise his spirits, as well as see how he's spent their money, and persuades him to take her deep into the Manu National Park in search of giant otters. Charlie then decides he needs to get involved with the locals and their way of life and joins Beto and Modesto on a four-day mission to illegally fell a giant hardwood tree.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Planet
programme.desc: Zoologist George McGavin continues his exploration of the primate world, considering how the secret to their success is the ability to live in close-knit family and social groups. This is demonstrated by the emperor tamarin males conned into childcare in Peru and the South African vervet monkeys that have a sophisticated alarm system to protect them from predators. But living together often has its problems, like the Barbary macaques in Gibraltar who have their babies stolen by others out to impress their boss, the matriarchal ring-tailed lemur societies where females battle one another with their children in tow, and the hamadryas baboons of Ethiopia where the males rule with an iron fist.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: Monty Halls explores the extraordinary ecosystem that covers an area larger than Great Britain, revealing that only seven per cent of it is coral reef. The rest is a variety of interconnected habitats, including hundreds of islands, mangrove swamps, deep-water gardens, vast sand flats, meadows of sea grass and what is said to be the world's oldest jungle. All are interconnected by a giant deep-water lagoon - and all are full of amazing wildlife.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Christina Trevanion vs Mark Stacey Foreign Antiques Market.
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Mark Stacey are off to Belgium, where a Victorian cane topper and an acupuncture model catch their eye, but it remains to be seen which is the most valuable.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk celebrates food created for royal jubilees, with chef Anna Haugh using unusual 19th-century ingredients found in a dish created for Queen Victoria's golden one.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: TV chefs Aldo Zilli and Ching-He Huang hunt for bargains in south-eastern England, hoping that a gold ring and antiques with an eastern origin will fare well at auction. Away from the search, Aldo meets a 200-year-old who supplied locals with flour, and animal-lover Ching learns how one man faced ridicule while trying to protect cattle in the 19th century.(n)

programme.title: The Big Family Cooking Showdown
programme.desc: New series. Competitive food show, presented by Zoe Ball and Nadiya Hussain, in which two families face a series of challenges based on the realities of everyday meals, cooking up their favourite dishes both in the studio and in their own homes. At the end of each show, judges Giorgio Locatelli and Rosemary Shrager will decide which family make it through to the next round, beginning with the Marks from west London up against the Charles family from Yorkshire.(n)

programme.title: Seven Days in Summer: Countdown to Partition
programme.desc: Set over the seven dramatic days leading up to the partition of India and Pakistan, this film gives a blow-by-blow account of that tumultuous week, as chaos consumed the Indian sub-continent during the last days of British Rule. From the flashpoints of the Punjab and Gandhi's base in Calcutta to the burning streets of Lahore and beyond, the film tells the powerful and moving story of some of the millions of people affected by this unique historical event, including original first-hand testimony voiced by actors, powerful archive footage and a cast of insightful experts.(n)

programme.title: Quacks
programme.desc: New series. Medical comedy set in Victorian London about four pioneers, friends and rivals who are fighting to make a mark on the world and save lives. In the first episode, surgeon Robert is put under pressure after a botched amputation, so John - a drug-addled dentist - who is trying to create the world's first anaesthetic, convinces Robert to use a potentially lethal ether in a pioneering operation.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark looks back on 70 years since the Partition of India. With accounts from the British and British Asians who lived through it and who will be in the audience, the programme explores how the event still shapes the relationship between India and Pakistan.(n)

programme.title: Dangerous Borders: A Journey Across India & Pakistan
programme.desc: New series. Seventy years after Partition, journalists Adnan Sarwar and Babita Sharma travel along the still-contentious border of Pakistan and India, finding out about the people who live there. They begin in the west in Adipur, which started out as a refugee camp for Hindus fleeing the newly created Muslim state of Pakistan, where Babita discovers a town that is an unlikely haven for Charlie Chaplin impersonators, while Adnan explores the cultural life of the metropolis of Karachi.(n)

programme.title: Olly Alexander: Growing up Gay
programme.desc: The Years & Years lead singer explores why the gay community is more vulnerable to mental health issues, as he opens up about his own long-term battle with depression. Olly joins young people on their own personal journeys as they battle issues that parallel his own, from homophobic bullying to eating and anxiety disorders, and questions what can be done to address them.(n)

programme.title: Queer as Art
programme.desc: The BBC continues to mark the 50th anniversary of decriminalisation of male homosexuality in the UK with its Gay Britannia season. This time, the focus falls on the LGBT contribution to the arts scene in the past half-decade, as Stephen Fry, David Hockney, Anthony Sher, Alan Cumming, Will Young and Alan Hollinghurst share their perspectives on the distinctive voices the community has brought to British cultural life. Also includes contributions by Val McDermid, Wayne Sleep, Julie Goodyear, Sandi Toksvig, Russell T Davies and many more.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: An exploration of how photography has been used and manipulated to construct the public personae of 10 major figures from history, beginning with the king of rock 'n' roll Elvis Presley. At the peak of his career, the singer's image was more carefully packaged than any other star before him, but Alfred Wertheimer talks about the series of spontaneous, unposed pictures he took of him as an unknown singer in New York, and a number of other photographers, including James Reid and Lew Allen, tell their own remarkable stories.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: At Newark International Antiques and Collectors Fair in Nottinghamshire, experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper help two teams pick up items to sell for profit at auction.(n)

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The search for relatives of an East London lady reveals a family connection to the most famous heist of the 20th century, and one heir hunter takes on much larger firms in Cheshire.(n)

programme.title: Orkney: When the Boat Comes In
programme.desc: The small island chain off the north-eastern tip of Scotland will be visited by more than 120,000 passengers from cruise liners, and on its busiest days the capital Kirkwall will see its population of 7,000 almost double. As part of the Our Lives strand, this documentary focuses on the impact of these tourists on the lives of Orcadians, with their arrival bringing much-needed revenue but also a growing concern about the environmental impact and for Orkney's world famous Neolithic sites, including Skara Brae.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Angela Malik, Ally McGrath and Michael Bremner continue their battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's Scotland final.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner explore Warwickshire, beginning by taking in the county at Chesterton Windmill before Brian visits a brewery, sampling their offerings and preparing beer-battered chicken goujons. Meanwhile, Janet explores Henley-in-Arden, and visits the regions most famous cheesemakers, along with Warwick Castle. Plus, Brian prepares his celebratory dish of Berkswell bread pudding.(n)

programme.title: I Bought a Rainforest
programme.desc: Nine months in and Charlie Hamilton James's project has hit rock bottom, so he decides to spend time with one of his neighbours - a Wacheperi shaman who treats sick people with traditional plants and hallucinogenic medicines. He then heads across the border to Brazil to meet a cattle rancher planning to burn down a huge chunk of virgin forest to increase the size of his farm, giving Charlie a clue as to how to make his scheme work. Back on his land, Charlie makes squatter Elias an offer and the pair embark on a new joint venture.(n)

programme.title: Monkey Planet
programme.desc: Zoologist George McGavin concludes his exploration of the primate world, considering their capacity to use tools and solve problems, something he claims sets them apart from most other families on the planet. By way of demonstration, the presenter goes to orang-utan school in Sumatra, visits Thailand to see long-tailed macaques floss their teeth with human hair and use tools to open oysters on the beach, and reveals how Ugandan chimpanzees pass on cultures and customs down the generations. He also meets a resourceful bonobo in the States that can order its own picnic on the phone and build a fire, on which it then toasts marshmallows.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: Monty Halls reveals how the Great Barrier Reef is vitally linked to the rest of the planet in many ways. Creatures travel thousands of miles to visit, from tiger sharks, great whales and seabirds to the largest green-turtle gathering on Earth and rarely seen alien-like creatures, such as the tentacled nautilus. The reef is also affected by weather systems travelling from across the Pacific, including cyclones that bring destruction and chaos to the coral and the creatures that live on it.(n)

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.sub-title: Christina Trevanion vs Mark Stacey Auction.
programme.desc: Antiques experts Christina Trevanion and Mark Stacey face off at an auction in Sevenoaks, where Christina plays catch-up and Mark falls in love with a romantic painting.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows including Mastermind and Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Royal Recipes
programme.desc: Michael Buerk celebrates royal food inspired by the days of India and Empire, as Paul Ainsworth cooks up quail and potato curry, said to be a favourite of Queen Victoria. Plus, historian Dr Annie Gray visits Osborne House on the Isle of Wight where Victoria, Empress of India, showcased her grand passion for the raj, and even hired her own Indian chefs.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: The treasure-hunting challenge continues, with comedians and impressionists Ronni Ancona and Jan Ravens taking to the road with experts Philip Serrell and James Braxton. Starting in the North Yorkshire town of Redcar, they head out on a hunt for items to sell at an auction in Stockport in Greater Manchester.(n)

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: New series. The story of the volunteer lifeboat crews and lifeguards of the RNLI who rescue thousands of people and save hundreds of lives around our coastline and on the River Thames every year. In the first episode, a father and daughter find themselves treading water for almost an hour hundreds of metres out at sea, and three fishermen swim for their lives as their trawler is smashed onto rocks in Ireland. Elsewhere in London, an unlucky tourist is minutes from hypothermia after falling into the Thames.(n)

programme.title: No More Boys and Girls: Can Our Kids Go Gender Free
programme.desc: Dr Javid Abdelmoneim sets out to discover if the differing treatment of young boys and girls is the reason that we are yet to achieve equality between the sexes. Javid embarks on a bold experiment as he subjects a class of primary school pupils from Lanesend in the Isle of Wight to `gender neutral' treatment, removing all of the stereotypical ways that boys and girls are treated differently.(n)

programme.title: MOTD: The Premier League Show
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents the magazine programme featuring news and action from the Premier League, plus interviews with the country's biggest football stars.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emma Barnett.(n)

programme.title: Seven Days in Summer: Countdown to Partition
programme.desc: Set over the seven dramatic days leading up to the partition of India and Pakistan, this film gives a blow-by-blow account of that tumultuous week, as chaos consumed the Indian sub-continent during the last days of British Rule. From the flashpoints of the Punjab and Gandhi's base in Calcutta to the burning streets of Lahore and beyond, the film tells the powerful and moving story of some of the millions of people affected by this unique historical event, including original first-hand testimony voiced by actors, powerful archive footage and a cast of insightful experts.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Taff: The River That Made Wales
programme.desc: Writer and fisherman Will Millard tells the story of how the once-polluted waterway was brought back from the dead to become one of the best salmon and trout rivers in Wales. Will travels from the source high in the Brecon Beacons National Park to Merthyr Tydfil, where he discovers that the town's ironworks were once vital to the British Empire. Along the way he trains with a mountain rescue team facing a unique set of challenges, meets a group of busy conservationists and fishes for wild brown trout in the most unlikely location.(n)

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: Exploring the forests, plains and bustling cities of Central Thailand, an area known as the nation's rice bowl. The programme explores how people live alongside animals in these areas, and the spiritual fulfilment to be found in these relationships. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo.(n)

programme.title: Utopia: In Search of the Dream
programme.sub-title: Build It And They Will Come.
programme.desc: Professor Richard Clay asks whether utopian visions for living can ever reconcile the tension between the group and the individual, the rules and the desire to break free. In America he encounters experimental communities searching for greater meaning in life. Interviewees include architect Norman Foster and designer Shoji Sadao.(n)

programme.title: This World
programme.sub-title: North Korea: Murder in the Family.
programme.desc: Documentary examining the murder of the North Korean dictator's half-brother Kim Jong-nam at Kuala Lumpur airport. The programme examines the activities of North Korean secret agents at the airport on the day of the killing, and reports on a powerful international business network that has allowed the Kim dynasty to remain in power for nearly 70 years.(n)

programme.title: The Brain with David Eagleman
programme.desc: The neuroscientist continues his exploration of the inner workings of the human brain, revealing how it gives rise to people's thoughts, emotions, memories and personality.(n)

programme.title: A History of Art in Three Colours
programme.desc: Art historian James Fox follows up his British Masters series by investigating artists' use of blue, white and gold, and explains how, by choosing these colours, painters have stirred emotions, changed the way people behave and had an impact on the course of history. He begins with gold and its use in early sun worship, before reinterpreting the treasures of the pharaohs, the mosaics of Byzantium and the work of Renaissance master Benvenuto Cellini. He also explores Gustav Klimt's The Kiss and discovers a Birmingham inventor who tried to achieve the alchemist's dream - turning base metals into gold.(n)

programme.title: Thailand: Earth's Tropical Paradise
programme.desc: Exploring the forests, plains and bustling cities of Central Thailand, an area known as the nation's rice bowl. The programme explores how people live alongside animals in these areas, and the spiritual fulfilment to be found in these relationships. Narrated by Sophie Okonedo.(n)

programme.title: This World
programme.sub-title: North Korea: Murder in the Family.
programme.desc: Documentary examining the murder of the North Korean dictator's half-brother Kim Jong-nam at Kuala Lumpur airport. The programme examines the activities of North Korean secret agents at the airport on the day of the killing, and reports on a powerful international business network that has allowed the Kim dynasty to remain in power for nearly 70 years.(n)

programme.title: Utopia: In Search of the Dream
programme.sub-title: Build It And They Will Come.
programme.desc: Professor Richard Clay asks whether utopian visions for living can ever reconcile the tension between the group and the individual, the rules and the desire to break free. In America he encounters experimental communities searching for greater meaning in life. Interviewees include architect Norman Foster and designer Shoji Sadao.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: The Taff: The River That Made Wales
programme.desc: Writer and fisherman Will Millard reflects on how the waterway is now one of the finest trout and salmon rivers in Wales, having once ran black with coal dust. He meets the members of the Lewis Merthyr Colliery Brass Band and fishes for grayling with a former miner who is now a champion fly fisherman. Will also visits one of Britain's biggest open cast coal mines and sees how the landscape is now being re-claimed after centuries of mining.(n)

programme.title: Fair Isle: Living on the Edge
programme.desc: Part two of two. Eleven-year-old Ythan and his family learn to deal with his homesickness, while new inhabitants Shaun and Rachel decide whether to stay on after their first winter.(n)

programme.title: Milton Keynes and Me
programme.desc: Award-winning filmmaker Richard Macer revisits his home town of Milton Keynes as he and the town both turn 50, as he sets out to revaluate his feelings for the place he grew up in. Richard meets with key contributors to the town such as architects, artists and social workers, hoping to witness the true reality for those living in the most famous 'new town' in the country.(n)

programme.title: The World's Most Photographed
programme.desc: An exploration of how photography has been used and manipulated to construct the public personae of 10 major figures from history, beginning with the king of rock 'n' roll Elvis Presley. At the peak of his career, the singer's image was more carefully packaged than any other star before him, but Alfred Wertheimer talks about the series of spontaneous, unposed pictures he took of him as an unknown singer in New York, and a number of other photographers, including James Reid and Lew Allen, tell their own remarkable stories.(n)

programme.title: Mind the Gap: Love Me Tender
programme.desc: Drama set in 1960, starring Julie Graham and Stuart McQuarrie. Billy loves Rose, but Rose loves Elvis and hopes her dream of visiting Graceland will be fulfilled.(n)

programme.title: Materials
programme.desc: In the first of three films telling the story of how mankind's knowledge of materials and their properties aided the development of civilisation, scientist Mark Miodownik charts how humans learned to use metals to their advantage. He explores early techniques for extracting copper from rocks, and explains how alloys such as steel rapidly expanded the range of tools, weapons and machines that mankind could create. He also analyses metals at an atomic level to reveal their more surprising properties, and discovers how crystals can be grown to survive in extreme environments - including the inside of a jet engine.(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 310. Mark Cuban, owner of 2011 NBA champions Dallas Mavericks, returns as Season 3 begins with a pitch from NBA Hall of Famer Bill Walton and triathlete Dave Meyer, who has designed a new water bottle. Other pitches include a celebrity ghostwriting business; an online funeral-planning venture; and a Web site that offers VIP access to nightlife activities around the U.S. Also: an update on a Season 2 customized-speakers venture(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 612. GoPro CEO Nick Woodman is a guest on the panel. Pitches include a farmer's healthier tortilla chip made from fresh-picked sweet corn; and the manufacturer of scented fire logs. Also: an update on Robert Herjavec's Season 5 investment in a company that sells ugly Christmas sweaters(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 728. Two guys claim to have a cure for people who are addicted to their cell phones; the Sharks are presented with the "coolest" toolbox ever made; things get emotional when Orlando entrepreneurs talk about the inspiration behind their wireless cuddly toy that tells math and science stories to children; and a pair of pet lovers from Austin pitch their one-of-a-kind accessories. Also: Lori Greiner takes 10 of the companies she has invested in to a Florida trade show(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 620. Transplanted Parisians offer the Sharks a taste of their grandmother's almond-water recipe; a NYC city duo look for an investment in their eco-friendly pizza box; a San Francisco entrepreneur claims to have come up with a "game changer in real-estate investing"; and cousins from Utah pitch their idea for sanitizing germ-ridden cell phones. Also: an update on GrooveBook, which Kevin O'Leary invested in during Season 5(n)

programme.desc: Robert and Ray are asked to film a video tribute to Frank, who has been named Man of the Year at his lodge, but find none of the other members can stand him.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne's ex-fiance Clive visits Seattle to declare his undying love and ask her to marry him. Rather than saying she cannot see a future for them, she decides to let him down gently and pretends to be Niles's wife. With David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz talks Frasier into going on a blind date with one of her friends - but Bulldog ends up falling in love with her. programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A recurring dream makes Frasier wonder whether he is gay, prompting him to search for a more reassuring explanation - with a little help from Niles. Comedy, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon becomes concerned that his comfortable lifestyle is having an impact on his professional progress and is stopping him from achieving scientific greatness, so he asks the gang to make life more difficult for him. Meanwhile, Howard invents an unflattering game about Raj. Starring Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Sheldon are forced to defend themselves against criticism from an online bully after publishing a physics paper. Meanwhile, the girls confront embarrassing moments from their pasts during a night in. Comedy, guest starring Stephen Hawking, with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.sub-title: Homer v Lisa and the Eighth Commandment.
programme.desc: Lisa is shocked by Homer's ploy to get illegal cable TV, fearing he is destined to go to hell for breaking one of the Ten Commandments - thou shalt not steal. Animated antics, with the voices of Yeardley Smith and Dan Castellaneta.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The TV breaks down, leaving everyone at a loose end - so Marge decides to fill the time by telling Bart and Lisa how she met and fell in love with Homer. With the guest voice of Jon Lovitz.(n)

programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Couples from Portsmouth and the Isle of Wight compete, as Maddi and Givon host a night of fine champagne and fusion food, and Ali and John cook a menu they have never made before.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou and the team receive a visit from a former Chelsea footballer who has brought along some expensive watches. James is also put to the test when asked to evaluate a hovercraft from a Bond film, and an unusual painting of Saddam Hussein causes a stir in the office. Also, there's a big surprise for a mother looking to sell some spectacular jewellery to help her son's business venture.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with former boxer Barry McGuigan joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Cheap Cheap Cheap
programme.desc: Delivery man Keith gets caught up in traffic, Barry and Noel try out a tandem ride, and a mother and daughter hope their knowledge of mini-rolls will help them win £25,000.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton shows five properties on Tenerife to newlywed couple Brian and Wendy Woods, who are looking to buy their dream home on the island within a budget of £180,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: B&B owners Derek and Lynne Love welcome the group to Langmead Guest House in Ramsgate, and invite their guests to take part in rounds of crazy golf with a twist.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Economics undergraduate David hosts on night two in Aberdeen, and the 1920s Gatsby-themed dress code goes down a storm with almost everyone.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and the family win a once-in-a-lifetime safari trip to Africa, where they encounter tribesmen, jungle animals - and the secretive owner of a chimpanzee refuge.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Grace is determined to get revenge on Darcy, Tegan goes job hunting, and Kim is at Sienna's side. Meanwhile, Neeta is jealous when she sees Hunter kiss Peri on their date.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Child Genius
programme.desc: Day two of the week-long competition as some of the country's cleverest eight to 12 year olds battle for the title of Britain's brightest child. Led by quizmaster Richard Osman, the remaining 17 competitors first face an exacting maths round - testing both written and mental arithmetic. There is also a complex memory round before 13 children proceed to the next stage.(n)

programme.title: Flights from Hell: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the extremes of human behaviour in airports and on planes. Footage includes angry missed check-ins to bizarre drunken antics at security, alternative safety briefings, deafening party flights and near-death experiences on flights from hell.(n)

programme.title: How to Get a Council House
programme.desc: The return of the documentary looking at how local authorities deal with a lack of properties and a growing number of people in need of homes at affordable rents, this time going behind the scenes with council officers in Portsmouth. A former naval engineer turns to Portsmouth City Council's housing office for help, having been homeless for nearly two years after the sudden death of his son led to alcoholism, the breakdown of his marriage and, finally, to life on the streets.(n)

programme.title: Delhi Cops
programme.desc: First of two programmes going behind the scenes with the under-resourced and over-worked police in India's most dangerous city, focusing on the increase in women officers.(n)

programme.title: Best Before: Music on 4
programme.desc: Hot Chip and the 2 Bears member Joe Goddard throws a secret party in his local pizza shop, featuring an eclectic mix of disco edits, left-field house and UK garage.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to Los Angeles to help La Frite, an outdated French restaurant that is failing to make any profits. His first step is to try to reconcile the feuding family members who run the business, and so devises a plan to bring them together by using secret filming.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Hollywood
programme.desc: Paul looks at how movie heroines went from damsels in distress to kick-ass action movie heroines such as Sigourney Weaver in Alien and Uma Thurman in Kill Bill. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hidden Restaurants with Michel Roux Jr
programme.desc: Michel is joined by fellow chef Freddy Bird to tour Britain in search of secret eateries and food mavericks, as he seeks inspiration for a three-course menu for his own restaurant The Oast House. In the first episode, Michel heads to the south west of England and discovers visual feasts inside a sculpture, and visits a floating cafe only reachable by boat.(n)

programme.title: Selling Houses with Amanda Lamb
programme.desc: Three rivals in Wolverhampton compete to sell their homes to buyer Simon, after snooping around each other's abodes and receiving £1,000 to make improvements. After receiving tips from the host, Ben and Josie take out a wall in their kitchen diner, while Lindsey comes up with his own ideas, and Raj and Pravin have their work cut out in making their mock-Tudor home more appealing.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is enlisted to help identical twins Matt and Chris Wickham buy their first home in north London, but a budget of £350,000 may not be enough to secure a property in their favoured areas of Pimlico and Victoria. Meanwhile, Phil Spencer offers advice to Sam Taylor and his fiancee Krystle Maher, who are keen to move from their rented flat in Deptford into a place of their own.(n)

programme.title: Double Your House for Half the Money
programme.sub-title: Sarah Beeny's Double Your House for Half the Money.
programme.desc: The property developer meets Candida Gubbins, who wants to dig beneath her London flat to create a whole new floor, providing more room for her young son and his friends. But a devastating flood looks set to put an end to her dreams. In Wolverhampton, Jay and Stephen hope to add a touch of glamour to the massive extension they are planning. Although they are both estate agents, the couple have never handled a building project before and they discover it's not easy trying to marry their love of bling with a modest budget.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will befriends an elderly man - much to Grace's dismay - and invites him to the 10th anniversary of their Games Night Spectacular. Meanwhile, despite Jack's best efforts, Karen remains in a quandary over Stan's past behaviour - until Malcolm confronts him in a steam room. Guest starring Richard Chamberlain.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra takes Ally and the twins to her parents' house, leaving Ray at home by himself - and he finds it impossible to get to sleep. American comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Peter Boyle.(n)

programme.desc: A desperate Ray does everything he can to get to the front of the queue to meet the New York Mets 1969 team at the National Baseball Hall of Fame. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin makes friends with reclusive author TH Houghton, to the considerable dismay of Niles and Frasier, who are frustrated that their own attempts to strike up an acquaintance have failed dismally. programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles hits the airwaves as a stand-in during Frasier's absence from his radio show, but gets more than he bargained for thanks to a star basketball player. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Daphne is dumped by her boyfriend and causes bemusement in the Crane household by immediately embarking on a new relationship - with a man who looks, dresses, talks and acts exactly like Niles. Comedy, starring Jane Leeves and David Hyde Pierce.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard receives shocking news as everyone prepares for the re-opening of the comic-book store. Meanwhile, Penny tries to teach Sheldon how to `let it go', but she is unable to follow her own advice when she learns something infuriating about Amy. Comedy, guest starring Nathan Fillion, with Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny agree to participate in an unusual experiment, and Leonard, Amy, Raj and Emily spend the evening trying to escape from a `zombie'. Elsewhere, Howard and Bernadette run into trouble at the airport after returning from Mrs Wolowitz's funeral. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer learns he has a long-lost half-brother and tracks him down to Detroit, where he is presented with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to make something of himself. Featuring the guest voice of Danny DeVito.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer makes an attempt to give Cupid a helping hand by arranging a date between Principal Skinner and Marge's man-hungry sister Selma. Animated comedy, with the voices of Dan Castellaneta and Harry Shearer.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

Day two sees Jaq and Jim attempt to blow away the opposition, while Chris and Liz present a posh take on some Yorkshire classic dishes. There is also a surprise in store for Bianca.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Boss James Constantinou and the team appraise more items brought along by members of the public. A divorcee from Newcastle wants to sell her £185,000 necklace to pay for her children's private-school fees, a crystal-covered drum kit used on a Kylie Minogue tour catches the eye of staff member Patrick, and a widowed pensioner hopes to make a fortune from her precious rings. Plus, a valuation doesn't come easy to the experts when a client turns up with a 7ft Terminator model.(n)

programme.desc: Danni Menzies tries to help software engineer Andy Forsyth and his partner Jacqui Monroe, who have decided the time is right to buy a second home on the island of Barbados.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Oil and gas purchasing specialist Sylvian hosts the third dinner party of the week, hoping that her ambitious global-themed menu will be enough to impress her guests.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.desc: The remaining competitors take on two gruelling History rounds, with the opening test posing questions on historical events spanning eras from Ancient Greece to the modern day. programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 79-year-old man arrives in hospital after collapsing in the street whilst walking his dog, and doctors give him medication to try and stabilise his very high heart rate. Meanwhile, a young boy is treated after pushing a plastic toy down his ear, and doctors show concern for a man who has numbness in his arm and little finger, and send him for a CT scan.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: In the final episode of the second series, Charles announces he will become absolute monarch, as the new Magna Carta decrees. He just needs one world leader's endorsement, Donald Trump. Wills and Kate oppose the absolute monarchy, and Pippa's wedding day arrives, but will Harry let her go through with it? Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Examining what happens when members of the public act as judge and jury, and carry out their own retribution. In Wiltshire, PCs John Miller and Hannah Agate pursue and catch two men who have threatened to kill someone who they believe has attacked a person they know, and in Trowbridge, a supermarket security guard's attempts to stop a shoplifter stealing alcohol has tragic consequences.(n)

programme.title: Catching the Tax Dodgers
programme.desc: With the public demanding more than ever that something must be done about tax avoidance and evasion, this documentary reveals for the first time the methods HM Revenue & Customs uses to find out who is and isn't paying tax and how they target those individuals. Leading the charge is Duncan McCallum, a veteran customs officer who has tackled drug rings, smugglers and massive duty fraud, while new teams are also targeting offshore accounts that could secure the Government millions in unpaid tax.(n)

programme.title: Poppy Cat
programme.desc: Zuzu accidentally spoils Owl's favourite painting, and then tries to hide it by suggesting everyone should head into the jungle to meet the artist in person.(n)
