programme.desc: Mungo crashes and forgets how to fly, so Digby resolves to teach him how to take to the skies again.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: It is time to show off Mummy Pig's newly finished book to Peppa's friends. However, Peppa and George lose some of the book while they are playing.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Grandpa Pig visits Peppa and George and brings seeds for them to plant, while Daddy Pig acts as a scarecrow.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: A lost sheet of beautiful music falls at Mofy and Kerry's feet, so they set out to reunite the score with its elusive feathered composer.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Mrs Figg's magic school is damaged, so a cake stall is organised to raise money for repairs, but no one can eat Queen Thistle's cakes.(n)

programme.title: Floogals
programme.desc: The trio are baffled to learn that the huge flowers they can see in the garden are grown from tiny seeds.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Julian Norton receives an emergency call from alpaca breeder Jackie, whose prize-winning female Cinderella is pregnant and struggling with a difficult labour. Back at the practice, Peter Wright is dealing with Larry the chinchilla, who is responsible for a population explosion and needs to be castrated, while Dougie the petulant parrot is due for a beak and nail trim.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Marcus Bentley narrates as the housemates lie in their beds, chat on the sofas and argue in the kitchen - all for the enjoyment of the viewers. Will they find being watched by Big Brother's cameras any harder to cope with than life in the public eye?.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin lends Scarlett his car to get away from Anderson and she opens up about her son's death. Ash invites Tori over for lunch and VJ plays peacemaker between Hunter and Peggy.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Amy discovers that her new doctor friend is Terese's villainous brother Nick. Fay tells Tyler, Mark and Aaron that their father is seriously ill and wants to see them.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bank at Quantico is robbed and a security guard killed, but the team soon discovers that stealing money may not have been the perpetrators' primary objective. Meanwhile, Gibbs is given the task of evaluating an inexperienced new agent assigned by Vance to help investigate the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rey Valentin.(n)

programme.title: I Didn't Kill My Sister
programme.desc: Heather works as an assistant to her news presenter sister Carmen but never seems to get a break of her own. Nevertheless she is there to pick up the pieces when the more successful sibling's marriage breaks down - only to be accused of murder when Carmen is found dead. Thriller, starring Nicholle Tom, Gina Holden and Chris William Martin.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Amy discovers that her new doctor friend is Terese's villainous brother Nick. Fay tells Tyler, Mark and Aaron that their father is seriously ill and wants to see them.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Justin lends Scarlett his car to get away from Anderson and she opens up about her son's death. Ash invites Tori over for lunch and VJ plays peacemaker between Hunter and Peggy.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell tells the story behind the design and construction of Isambard Kingdom Brunel's famous bridge over the picturesque Avon gorge at Bristol, and discovers that some people question whether it was entirely the product of his own devising. The bridge remained unfinished in Brunel's lifetime, but when he died in 1859, his friends decided that the bridge should be completed as a memorial, using the chains from another of his suspension bridges that was being demolished.(n)

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers with Alan Davies
programme.desc: Inspector Kate Ford becomes worried about a staffie-cross that appears to be dangerously underweight. The owner claims to regularly feed the dog, and Kate is desperate to get an appointment with a vet, which proves to be no easy task. At Block Fen RSPCA, staff work to rehabilitate a lurcher that was tied to a fence and abandoned, and a trainee police dog competes against more experienced sniffer hounds in a mission to locate concealed firearms.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the latest eviction show, announcing the least popular housemate and chatting to them about their time in the house and how they got on with their fellow contestants. There's also the usual round-up of yesterday's action.(n)

programme.title: Make or Break
programme.desc: The participants continue their quest to determine whether they are currently dating the `one', but things are becoming increasingly personal between the couples. Jess makes an unusual discovery that could result in a few awkward conversations with conquests past and present, and Matty tells Andy precisely what he thinks of him. Plus, Karl makes a potentially catastrophic relationship blunder.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the CBB companion show, featuring gossip, chat and features from the house. Including a debate on the burning issues, celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments and behind-the-scenes insights.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother: Live from the House
programme.desc: A quick visit to the house for CBB fans for whom the nightly updates simply aren't enough. Every move and word made by the famous housemates is captured as it happens - with the odd burst of birdsong replacing those moments the censors don't want people to hear.(n)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Julian Norton is called out to help a pregnant cow that is struggling to give birth to its calf. When it becomes clear the lives of both animals may be in jeopardy, Julian is forced to consider performing an emergency caesarean. Meanwhile, Peter Wright comes to the aid of Lofty, a horse in need of some dental work, and a concerned caller reports a bird with an unusual - and embarrassing - injury.(n)

programme.title: The Railways That Built Britain with Chris Tarrant
programme.desc: The broadcaster examines how trains transformed the nation and shaped modern Britain. He begins in the cab of Puffing Billy, the world's oldest-surviving steam locomotive, which was built in 1813 and designed to move coal along a five-mile stretch of track from a Northumberland mine to the docks. Chris also tells the story of Henry Booth, who not only championed George Stephenson's famous Rocket, but also helped finance it, and talks about the work of the navvies who dug the tunnels and laid the tracks.(n)

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Californian interior designer and estate agent Ann Maurice visits a five-bedroom house on the market in Northwich, Cheshire, and advises the owners on making it more attractive to would-be buyers.(n)

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Paul Binski visits Brighton and Kilburn Park, north London, to explore two striking missionary churches that reflect the High Church style of architecture.(n)

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of dedicated volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary.(n)

programme.title: Poppy Cat
programme.desc: Alma's cousin Chester invites her to sing with him at a concert, but she loses her voice due to nerves. A trip in a hot-air balloon, however, helps to rebuild her confidence.(n)

programme.title: Puffin Rock
programme.desc: Children's animation following the adventures of a family of puffins living on a wild and beautiful Irish island. Narrated by Chris O'Dowd.(n)

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Lou and Ferdinand come over the play at Simon's house, but when he starts to boss them around, they leave him on his own until he learns everyone is equal.(n)

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Muck has the unenviable task of transporting a manure delivery to the town hall, where Bob has built some new raised beds.(n)

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman turns circus-master as he directs an energetic show in the park, the same place station officer Steele is currently working on his delicate model village.(n)

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Bradford the Brake Van arrives in Sodor, but Thomas decides to go off without him and gets into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey
programme.desc: Monkey discovers a new, fast and comfortable way to get from one place to another.(n)

programme.title: Shimmer and Shine
programme.desc: The twin genies-in-training discover a magical gem that makes two of everything - including Zeta.(n)

programme.title: Noddy: Toyland Detective
programme.sub-title: The Case of the Moving Train Tracks.
programme.desc: Noddy is on the case when someone moves the train tracks, stopping everyone from getting to Fable Forest for the annual fairy picnic.(n)

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: When an ice sheet cracks and some polar bears get swept out to sea, Ryder and his canine friends must board the Air Patroller and fly to the Arctic to rescue lost cubs.(n)

programme.title: Rusty Rivets
programme.desc: When there's a job to do and the stakes are high, ten-year-old Rusty Rivets invents his way out of every jam by repurposing parts and objects into the wildest, greatest contraptions ever!.(n)

programme.title: Digby Dragon
programme.desc: Digby gets growing pains after discovering that he has not grown all year, so Fizzy tries one of her simple growing spells.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George explore the greenhouse, which is full of lovely tomatoes and basil. When it is time for dinner, Granny Pig makes a tasty salad.(n)

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Dr Hamster struggles to cope on a busy day when everyone seems to require treatment.(n)

programme.title: Mofy
programme.desc: The fluffy white rabbit plants some seeds, and is eager to see them grow, but nature takes its time.(n)

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Mrs Witch comes out of retirement to keep her place in the Little Kingdom when a young pretender plans to move into her house.(n)

programme.title: Floogals
programme.desc: The aliens accidentally erase Dad Hooman's work while investigating his pencil, and must re-draw it all before he notices.(n)

programme.title: The Wright Stuff
programme.desc: Matthew Wright and his guests talk about the issues of the day, with viewers calling in to offer their opinions.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.desc: Julian receives a late-night emergency call to help a cow give birth, but the delivery is more complicated than expected, with the mother and calf's lives hanging in the balance. Alfie the labrador is brought to Skeldale following an unusual baking incident, having swallowed a spatula while trying to steal some food.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Lunchtime
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Emma Willis presents the latest eviction show, announcing the least popular housemate and chatting to them about their time in the house and how they got on with their fellow contestants. There's also the usual round-up of yesterday's action.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Maggie learns about a vacancy at the school and tries to convince Ben to make the move permanent, Tori struggles with her feelings for Ash, and Alf finds out the pier is for sale.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: As the Brennan boys react to news of their father's death, Fay makes Sheila privy to a secret concerning Russell's parentage. Amy fumes after Leo tells her to stay away from Nick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs sends DiNozzo and Ziva to retrieve top-secret information from a secure military base - a mission aimed at catching a mole in the NCIS ranks. Unfortunately, it soon becomes clear that the traitor is still at large - so the building is locked down and all agents are rounded up in a final effort to catch the culprit. Guest starring Jude Ciccolella.(n)

programme.title: Baby Sellers
programme.desc: The owner of an adoption agency maintains a respectable reputation, while secretly the children she provides to desperate clients are obtained by illegal means. A customs agent develops suspicions about the criminal network behind the trade in kidnapped infants and tries to expose the scandal. Crime drama, starring Jennifer Finnigan and Kirstie Alley. Edited for violence.(n)

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: As the Brennan boys react to news of their father's death, Fay makes Sheila privy to a secret concerning Russell's parentage. Amy fumes after Leo tells her to stay away from Nick.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Maggie learns about a vacancy at the school and tries to convince Ben to make the move permanent, Tori struggles with her feelings for Ash, and Alf finds out the pier is for sale.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Tonight
programme.desc: A round-up of the evening's headlines, including coverage of the latest national and international stories.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: A Yorkshire landlord has to call in eviction specialists to remove tenants from the house he inherited from his grandparents. Music entrepreneur Donovan has not received rent from one of his tenants for seven months, so the case ends up in court.(n)

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The doctors and nurses of Horfield Health Centre turn their attention to patients dealing with persistent pain, both physical and psychological. First up is Valentine, who is undergoing male-to-female gender reassignment, but faces a long and arduous journey to her desired destination. Dr Tom Pelly helps Vera, who is worried that her bad shoulder might be a sign of worse things to come, and Dr Alison Bolam solves the mystery of why visually impaired patient David is experiencing pain in his eyes and face. Dr Jane Edge believe impetigo might be the cause of Agnese's woes, and Dr Elizabeth Barnard suspects Hannah's abdominal pains might be something far more serious than a case of gastroenteritis.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother
programme.desc: Highlights of the housemates' past 24 hours under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother as the celebrities cope with living under constant surveillance, with all the arguments and alliances, as well as the revelations in the diary room.(n)

programme.title: Make or Break
programme.desc: The remaining couples continue to place their tenuous pairings under scrutiny, but for some, working out whether they could really become an item is not an easy task. For one pair, though, the answer seems to be clear. After yet another blunder, Karl tries to explain his actions, but Holly's patience has run out.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Big Brother's Bit on the Side
programme.desc: Rylan Clark-Neal presents the CBB companion show, featuring gossip, chat and features from the house. Including a debate on the burning issues, celebrity guests' thoughts on the latest developments and behind-the-scenes insights.(n)

programme.title: In a Valley of Violence
programme.desc: Mysterious loner Paul, headed to Mexico with his collie at his side, stumbles into a small-town saloon. There, he brawls with a gang and finds himself exiled by the town marshal, which sparks a bloody quest for revenge in this clever, offbeat Western(n)

programme.title: Master Of The Shadowless Kick: Wong Kei-ying
Mafia!
programme.desc: Packed to the gills with references to mob movies from The Godfather to Casino, the story of an Italian boy who comes to America and becomes entangled with the all-powerful Mafia provides on opportunity for director Jim Abrahams to poke fun at the genre in his distinctive gag-a-minute style using everything from visual puns to verbal acrobatics in his quest to raise a laugh. The gags come thick and fast in this Mafia spoof from the makers of Airplane! and The Naked Gun(n)

programme.title: To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar
programme.desc: Three New York drag queens travel cross-country on their way to Hollywood, but a broken-down car strands them in a narrow-minded country town, where they share makeup tips with the ladies and show the hostile men how to treat women right(n)

programme.title: Capote
programme.desc: An exemplary biopic that focuses on the six years Capote spent working on his 1966 masterpiece "In Cold Blood"(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Based upon Mark Millar's explosive graphic novel series and helmed by stunning visualist director Timur Bekmambetov, Wanted stars Academy Award-winners Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman as members of a secret fraternity of assassins. James McAvoy portrays a slacker who is unexpectedly recruited to join the ranks of these elite fighters. As his powers and skills increase under their tutelage, however, he begins to waver between heroism and vengeance, and discovers that there is more to his dangerous associates than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Old School
programme.desc: After walking in on his girlfriend cheating, lawyer Mitch sets up home near the local college. It's just the chance his thirtysomething pals have been waiting for: they turn his new house into a 24-hour party house. Comedy(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: Set in northern Australia before World War II, an English aristocrat who inherits a sprawling ranch reluctantly pacts with a stock-man in order to protect her new property from a takeover plot. As the pair drive 2,000 head of cattle over unforgiving landscape, they experience the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by Japanese forces firsthand(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula and Ian are parents to a teenage daughter in this sequel that brings the entire Portokalos family together for another huge wedding(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: Buddy action thriller in which two LAPD rejects who end up as security guards are forced to go on the run when they uncover a sophisticated smuggling operation, but they seem more intent on fighting each other than the villains(n)

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: In this hysterical comedy, two mild-mannered cousins search for a beloved pet kitten after the feline is taken during a home burglary. However, they get in over their heads when their quest leads them to infiltrate a violent street gang by posing as drug dealers(n)

programme.title: Cast Away
programme.desc: FedEx employee Chuck Noland lives his life by clockwork. But his promise to his girlfriend to be back from Moscow for New Year looks doubtful when a terrifying plane crash strands him on a Pacific island(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: Wanted
programme.desc: Based upon Mark Millar's explosive graphic novel series and helmed by stunning visualist director Timur Bekmambetov, Wanted stars Academy Award-winners Angelina Jolie and Morgan Freeman as members of a secret fraternity of assassins. James McAvoy portrays a slacker who is unexpectedly recruited to join the ranks of these elite fighters. As his powers and skills increase under their tutelage, however, he begins to waver between heroism and vengeance, and discovers that there is more to his dangerous associates than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Off Air
programme.desc: Off Air(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: A man gets a last-chance job coaching a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team and faces the dual challenge of bringing this underdog team to the 1951 state championship and redeeming himself from a mysterious past(n)

programme.title: Wildcats
programme.desc: Molly McGrath quits her cushy middle-class teaching job to become a high-school football coach at an inner-city school. Facing culture and gender clashes, and a personal child-custody battle, Molly has her work cut out for her, but she's determined to convince the team that they can win(n)

programme.title: Private Benjamin
programme.desc: Goldie Hawn stars in this comedy as a high society woman who joins the army after her newly married husband dies on their wedding night(n)

programme.title: Rock Star
programme.desc: Loosely inspired by the true story of the heavy metal band Judas Priest, this music industry fable from director Stephen Herek is based on a script by actor-turned-writer/director John Stockwell. Mark Wahlberg stars as Chris Cole, a wannabe rock star who works by day as a copy machine repairman and by night as the lead singer of Blood Pollution, a Pennsylvania tribute band that imitates the best-selling heavy metal rockers of Steel Dragon. Although he's supported by his girlfriend Emily (Jennifer Aniston), Chris is devastated when his friends kick him out of the band he founded. His humiliation doesn't last long, however, as Chris soon learns that he's been tapped to replace the lead singer of Steel Dragon, literally becoming a rock star overnight. Chris soon has everything he's ever wanted but is disappointed to discover that being a superstar isn't everything it's cracked up to be. Rock Star was produced under two other titles, "Metal God" and "So You Want to Be a Rock Star."(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Seafaring adventure as, during the Napoleonic wars, a British frigate is sent to track and engage a larger French warship, the Acheron, off the coast of South America. The intense and duty-driven captain of the British vessel must try to coax his war-weary crew to victory, amid a series of explosive naval battle scenes. Based on the novels by Patrick O'Brian(n)

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: An Afghanistan War veteran living in London seeks revenge against his pregnant girlfriend's killer by assuming an upper-class identity and using his connections in the Chinese mob(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. This high-octane action thriller is a remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: The Divergent Series: Allegiant
programme.desc: Tris and Four journey beyond the wall surrounding Chicago, and get caught up in a battle for the fate of humanity(n)

programme.title: Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Charlie's trio of private investigators, Natalie, Dylan and Alex, must locate stolen rings that contain encrypted information about the Witness Protection Program(n)

programme.desc: A naive Texan aims to become a New York City gigolo, a forms a mutually-beneficial friendship with a hustler who takes him under his wing. When the hustler's health starts to fail, the Texan turns one final trick in a selfless bid to take his new friend to Miami(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: The story of a prison guard who develops a poignant, unusual relationship with one inmate who possesses a magical gift that is both mysterious and miraculous(n)

programme.channel: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)
programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: Free to Murder Again. The Texas penal system wakes up from a nightmare in the A&E program American Justice: Free to Murder Again. The subject of the documentary is serial killer Kenneth McDuff, the biggest mistake the parole board ever made. McDuff was first sentenced to death in 1968 for killing three teenagers. Seemingly, his incarceration meant the end of his murder spree. But due to the overcrowding of Texas jails, McDuff was eventually released after serving only 21 years. Soon, the criminal was back on the streets harassing children and adults alike. In 1991, McDuff abducted and killed a young woman only to repeat the pattern two years later with a pregnant mother of two. When he was captured and resentenced to death, his murderous trail was reported to include a handful of others. McDuff's situation alerted the government to the failures of the parole boards. His case eventually resulted in a slew of new prison constructions and tough law reforms(n)

programme.desc: Part one of two. An archaeologist discovers a set of human remains in the Shetlands, but before it can be proven whether the find is ancient or contemporary, local woman Mima Wilson is shot dead on the same site. The police investigation uncovers a deep division between the victim's family and rich local clan the Haldanes, so members of the latter fall under suspicion - especially when it transpires that one was out shooting on the night of the murder and another lacks a convincing alibi. Douglas Henshall, Alison O'Donnell, Gemma Chan and Steven Robertson star.(n)

programme.title: Fever Pitch
programme.desc: Nick Hornby's acclaimed memoir about one man's struggle to balance his love of a woman and his love for soccer was the basis of a well-reviewed British film in 1997, and now gets a Americanized rewrite with this picture, in which the game is changed from soccer to baseball. Ben (Jimmy Fallon) is a high-school teacher who meets Lindsay (Drew Barrymore), who has a successful career in business. Ben and Lindsay don't appear to have much in common on the surface, but they hit it off and are soon involved in a serious romance. But when spring rolls around, Lindsay becomes aware of the true love of Ben's life -- the Boston Red Sox. Despite the team's lamentable record, Ben has been a fiercely loyal Red Sox fan since childhood, and Lindsay finds it hard to compete with his passion for baseball, while Ben is forced to choose between the obsessions of his youth and the enthusiasms of a responsible adult. Fever Pitch was shot in part in Boston during the 2004 baseball season, which to the surprise of the filmmakers saw the Red Sox winning baseball's world series for the first time since 1918(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren is struggling to cope with his blackmailer and goes too far when he begins pointing the finger at other villagers. Tony witnesses Warren locking Shane in the back of a van and drags him into The Loft to calm him down.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys compete for a tenured professor position at the university, leading them to try to win over the committee in charge of appointing a new staff member, and arguing about who deserves the spot the most. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy tries to help Sheldon get over his desire for closure when one of his favourite TV shows is cancelled on a cliffhanger ending. programme.title: Tattoo Fixers on Holiday

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Comic-book store owner Stuart asks Amy out on a date, forcing a jealous Sheldon to consider the future of his relationship with her. programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The team explores the Arctic Ocean, one of the most hostile environments on Earth, yet one that plays a crucial part in controlling the climate of the planet. Paul Rose and the crew dive beneath the polar ice cap to examine how the ice, the dominant feature of the ocean, is shrinking and how this could affect the rest of the world. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age Giants
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explains what the remains of mammals reveal about how they fared in cold climates. In Transylvanian caves, she discovers evidence of a conflict between a cave bear and a lion, both of which became victims of a deep freeze that swept across Europe, while in Siberia she finds that the well-preserved remains of a female woolly rhinoceros demonstrate it was perfectly evolved to face the bitter conditions in Yakutsk - the coldest city on Earth. Alice also travels to a Jersey cave, where archaeological findings shed light on how Ice Age human beings and Neanderthals fashioned stone tools to hunt mammoths.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall joins Terry Nutkins to learn how dangerous the otter is, before he sets out to locate the UK's largest spider and track down a peregrine falcon.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: The team heads north to Alaska, where days and nights of freezing weather must be endured to catch a glimpse of a wolverine. Some cheeky Arctic foxes are also spotted, and Steve Backshall resolves not to leave the state until he has seen a grizzly bear.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Wildlife series examining the challenges predators face as they stalk their prey, and revealing how it is far more common for hunts to end in failure. The first episode demonstrates how leopards use stealth and concealment to get close to their prey, while African wild dogs have to work as a team. The programme also features footage of killer whales, which rely on their intelligence, Nile crocodiles that can wait years between meals, spiders able to spin 25 foot webs and amur falcons, which travel 16,000 miles every year to hunt insects. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: The team explores the Arctic Ocean, one of the most hostile environments on Earth, yet one that plays a crucial part in controlling the climate of the planet. Paul Rose and the crew dive beneath the polar ice cap to examine how the ice, the dominant feature of the ocean, is shrinking and how this could affect the rest of the world. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hunters of the South Seas
programme.desc: Will Millard explores the Coral Triangle in the western Pacific, interacting with indigenous communities to learn how they have thrived in spite of their extreme isolation. In the village of Sampela, home to 1,500 Bajau people, Will lives with spear fisherman Kabei and his family in their small stilt house. He witnesses the Bajau's breathtaking skills in the water, learns how Kabei hasn't set foot on dry land for three years, and looks at what the future holds for this remarkable community.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: An insight into the lives of some of the world's cutest animals.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Ice Age Giants
programme.desc: Alice Roberts sets out to discover why the creatures that dominated the planet 40,000 years ago died out as the world started to warm up and the end of the Ice Age neared. She examines how the woolly rhino was unable to adapt when the increase in snowfall prevented it eating enough grass, and learns that mastodons turned on one another.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: The team continues the search for deadly animals in the Arizona desert, where Steve Backshall demonstrates the hunting prowess of the Harris hawk by acting as its prey. He also uses state-of-the-art technology to track down rattlesnakes, before heading to the mountains in search of a cougar.(n)

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: Steve Backshall searches for deadly creatures in the swamps of Louisiana, finding alligators, cottonmouth snakes and predatory turtles.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.sub-title: In the Grip of the Seasons.
programme.desc: Cameras follow predators living in the Arctic, who face a particularly challenging search for food, as the environment around them constantly changes with the seasons, from a continent of ice in perpetual darkness to a scattering of islands in constant sunshine. A polar bear climbs to reach a birds' nest, while another makes holes in the ice to catch seals. Plus, a look at how Arctic foxes have adapted to catch auks in mid-flight and the hunting strategies of Arctic wolves. Narrated by David Attenborough.(n)

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.(n)

programme.title: Hunters of the South Seas
programme.desc: Will Millard interacts with indigenous communities in the most remote corner of the Coral Triangle. He heads to the Trobriand Islands, 150 miles off the east coast of Papua new Guinea, where he discovers a trading network called the Kula Ring. On the largest island, Kiriwina, he meets Edric and Nagiya who introduce him to ancient customs including funeral rites, feasts and fishing traditions, which remain untouched by modern tourism.(n)

programme.title: Bolt
programme.desc: Bolt is a heroic dog, spending his life saving the world in general and his co-star Penny in particular. He doesn't realise his life is a TV show, but when he's tricked off the show and airmailed to New York, he must face the fact that he doesn't actually have super powers. However he is still worried Penny might be in danger, and enlists the help of street-wise alley cat and a TV obsessed hamster, to return to LA and save her. A Disney/Pixar masterpiece full of adventure, laughs and friendship(n)

programme.title: Robots
programme.desc: From the creators of "Ice Age" comes another hilarious and visually dazzling animated adventure for the family. An all-star voice cast that includes Ewan McGregor and Robin Williams cuts loose in the story of a small-town robot who goes to the big city to pursue his dream of becoming an inventor. Other voices include Halle Berry, Mel Brooks and Amanda Bynes(n)

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: A handsome and successful bachelor is taken aback when his dream girl asks him to be the "maid" of honour in her upcoming wedding. Tom and Hannah have been best friends for years. Through all the hard times, Hannah has been the one constant in Tom's life, and the one person he knows he can always rely on. When Hannah leaves on a business trip to Scotland, Tom is surprised to realise how truly lonely he is without her, so the moment she returns, Tom resolves to ask for her hand in marriage. But apparently Hannah's trip wasn't all business, because upon returning home Hannah announces that she has gotten engaged to a dashing Scotsman and will soon be starting a new life overseas. With his spirits crushed but his love for Hannah stronger than ever before, Tom reluctantly agrees to be the "maid" of honour so that he can prove his love in no uncertain terms and convince her to call off the wedding before true happiness slips through his fingers(n)

programme.title: Sweet Home Alabama
programme.desc: Melanie only has to sort out one final detail before her glitzy marriage to the son of New York's mayor: her divorce papers from Jake. The childhood sweethearts split years ago, but Mel soon finds out that the spark is still there(n)

programme.title: A View to a Kill
programme.desc: In Roger Moore's last outing as the suave agent James Bond, 007 jets across the Atlantic to foil a diabolical villain's plot to destroy California's 'Silicon Valley' by starting an earthquake. The resultant destruction will make the villain - who is hoping to corner the microchip market a very rich man(n)

programme.title: Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: In the year 2029, an astronaut whose unauthorised mission to rescue a chimp companion from a mysterious space storm crash-lands on a planet where apes rule and humans are sold into slavery(n)

programme.title: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
programme.desc: In this adventure-filled sequel to the 2004 blockbuster 'National Treasure', Nicolas Cage reprises his role as artifact hunter and archaeologist Benjamin Franklin Gates. During a lecture about John Wilkes Booth (Abraham Lincoln¿s murderer) and Thomas Gates (Ben¿s great-grandfather), another treasure hunter by the name of Mitch Wilkinson stands up and presents a missing page of Booth¿s diary -- where Thomas is mentioned as a co-conspirator in Lincoln¿s assassination. Outraged, Ben decides to prove the honor of his ancestor, and together with his wife, Abigail, and his best friend, the writer Riley Poole, heads to France, England and Washington to collect clues(n)

programme.title: 5 Days of War
programme.desc: In the midst of an intense five-day war between Russia and the Georgian Republic, a rogue American journalist, his loyal cameraman, and a desperate local woman fight to reveal the truth about the atrocities being committed against innocent civilians. Andy Garcia, Val Kilmer, Rupert Friend, and Emmanuelle Chriqui star in this explosive war drama from Die Hard 2 director Renny Harlin(n)

programme.title: A Good Year
programme.desc: Gladiator duo Ridley Scott and Russell Crowe re-team for this adaptation of author Peter Mayle's best-selling novel about a London-based investment banker who relocates to Provence in hopes of selling a small vineyard he has inherited from his recently deceased uncle. As a child, Max Skinner (Freddie Highmore) was taught to appreciate the finer things in life while wandering the vineyard estate of his sophisticated uncle Henry (Albert Finney). Life has a strange way or turning out how you least expect it to though, and 25 years later, Max (Russell Crowe) is now a prosperous moneyman wheeling and dealing in the cutthroat world of London business. When Max learns that Henry has recently passed away and that he has been named the sole beneficiary of his late uncle's modest estate, the keen businessman hastily arranges a flight to France in order to assess the value of the old property and get it prepped for sale. After Max arrives to find the vineyard in a crumbling state of disrepair, his troubles are further compounded by the stubbornness of gruff estate winemaker M. Duflot (Didier Bourdon) and the unexpected arrival of a determined California beauty named Christie (Abbie Cornish), who presents herself as a long-lost cousin while making a dubious claim to Henry's estate. Meanwhile, the overstressed Max reluctantly finds himself falling for local café owner and town siren Fanny (Marion Cotillard), whose formidable guard is quickly worn down by the smitten beneficiary(n)

programme.desc: A pacifist deliveryman who practices marital arts enters an underground fighting tournament in order to win enough money to keep his master's temple from being destroyed. In time, success in the ring brings out his dark side(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu Hustle
programme.desc: The work of international superstar Stephen Chow, Kung Fu Hustle is a humorous, special-effects-filled, action-packed martial arts epic set in early '40s China. A bumbling thief named Sing (Stephen Chow) desires to be the toughest member of the dreaded gangster hit squad known as The Axe Gang, but to completely join the gang he has to commit murder. When Sing attempts to rob a crowded run-down apartment complex known as Pig Sty Alley, the locals begin to defend themselves with some high-flying kung fu skills, and a tiny war erupts between the local masters and the axe-wielding gang. After the gang busts the ancient kung fu king known as The Beast (Leung Siu Lung) out of jail, tensions reach a boiling point as Pig Sty Alley's landlady (Yuen Qiu) leads an all-out attack against the gang and Sing discovers his true heroic fate. Kung Fu Hustle, which set box-office records across Asia during its December 2004 release, also stars Yuen Wah and Xing Yu, and features fight choreography by legendary masters of martial arts cinema Yuen Woo Ping and Sammo Hung(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: The mysterious fifth element when combined with four others creates the ultimate weapon against universal evil. The story begins in 1914 when benign aliens visit an ancient Egyptian temple to steal four stones containing information about this mysterious element. The visitors promise to return to Earth in the future to save it from evil. Three centuries pass and Earth is threatened by a thunderous Cosmic Evil. Unfortunately, the Evil killed the Good aliens who promised to save the planet. Fortunately, Earthlings have a piece of one of the alien saviors. Utilizing DNA restructuring, scientists grow the piece into a perfect new alien which takes the form of a curvaceous, seductive no-holds barred redheaded acrobat who escapes from the lab with the police in hot pursuit. Desperately she dives into a cab reluctantly driven by luckless former special force officer (Bruce Willis) who suddenly finds himself faced with the task of saving the universe by finding the missing stones and vanquishing the evil forces. Featuring dazzling special effects and classy production values coupled with a healthy splash of outlandish high fashion the emphasis of Besson's film is not so much plot as it is over-the top spectacle(n)

programme.title: Fortress
programme.desc: An expectant couple are sentenced to a high-tech prison in a futuristic society where population growth is state-controlled(n)

programme.title: Pineapple Express
programme.desc: Dale Denton, a process server with a weed fixation, witnesses a murder and turns to his dealer, Saul, for support. The murderer is actually Saul's main drug supplier, and because of Saul's access to some extremely rare high-grade pot (called Pineapple Express) the two are quickly tracked down and put on the run(n)

programme.desc: An experienced career thief is set up by a young upstart gangster and the two self-styled criminal masterminds find themselves in a turf battle neither much cares about. The skirmish eventually attracts the attention of a female cop(n)

programme.title: Jaws: The Revenge
programme.desc: Fourth in the series of action adventures about a malevolent great white shark. After her younger son is killed in the water, the widow of the man who killed the first Amity great white shark begins to believe her entire family is targeted by a monster of the deep. She heads for the Bahamas to warn her other son, a marine biologist, unaware that she is being followed by a large, hungry shark intent on revenge(n)

programme.title: Flyboys
programme.desc: As World War I rages in Europe and Allied forces in France, Italy, and England find their resolve quickly diminishing due to the overwhelming force of the German juggernaut, a handful of brave American soldiers volunteer to join their French counterparts in learning to fly and fighting for freedom from above as the true story of the legendary Lafayette Escadrille comes to the screen in a breathtaking war adventure from Academy Award-winning director Tony Bill and famed producer Dean Devlin. They have come from all over the United States, ready and willing to put their lives on the line despite their country's initial pledge to not get involved with the all-consuming war that rages throughout Europe. Few could have foreseen the challenges faced by the world's first fighter pilots, however, and upon arriving at their aerodrome in France, the aspiring aviators are assigned to a new squadron under the command of war-ravaged Captain Thenault (Jean Reno) and battle-weary American pilot Reed Cassidy -- the sole survivor of his devastated former air brigade. With little encouragement from their fellow aviators and nothing to drive but their unifying goal of taking to the skies and offering up their lives in the name of freedom, the determined airmen of the Lafayette Escadrille set out to make history by embarking on the adventure of a lifetime. James Franco, Martin Henderson, and David Ellison star in a script penned by Phil Sears, Blake T. Evans, and David S. Ward(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Natalie persuades Adrian to become a full-time private eye, but his first case seems disappointingly trivial - until it leads him into a far more dangerous investigation culminating in a high-speed boat chase at sea. Detective drama, starring Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to the Ball Game.
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of a wealthy executive quickly reveals that the victim may not have been the assassin's intended target. Adrian is led to a baseball game as he gradually pieces the puzzle together. Detective drama, starring Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to the Circus.
programme.desc: Stottlemeyer suspects a circus animal trainer is responsible for the murder of an unpopular ringmaster - but Adrian focuses his investigation on the victim's ex-wife, a trapeze artist who is also a sharpshooter. Detective drama, starring Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and the team investigate the death of a man who was the prime suspect in the murder of two girls 10 years earlier, prompting a detective to come out of retirement to help with the case. Crime drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: New evidence associated with the murder of a homeopathist comes to light, prompting Brenda to revisit the case. Meanwhile, the detective's family pays a surprise visit.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A day spent working on a cut-and-dried case leaves the team free to spend some time away from work, and while McGee and Delilah argue over the importance of keeping shop-talk to a minimum, DiNozzo ends up boring his dinner date with crime-solving tales. However, the agents' personal plans are all interrupted as, one-by-one, they realise errors have been made in closing their latest investigation. Starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An American couple are attacked in Iraq, in the very same spot a group of US Special Ops snipers were ambushed six months earlier. Determined to get to the bottom of the case, Gibbs is forced to speak to Aaron Davis, the only survivor of the first assault, who is now struggling through PTSD at the Walter Reed Medical Center. The 300th episode of the military crime drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk and the Very, Very Old Man.
programme.desc: Stottlemeyer is thrown out by his wife and reluctantly goes to stay with Adrian. They both have difficulty adjusting to the arrangement, and find themselves permanently at loggerheads - until two very different murder investigations prompt them to set aside their differences. Tony Shalhoub and Ted Levine star.(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to the Theatre.
programme.desc: Sharona asks Adrian to clear her sister Gail of murdering a fellow actor who died on stage in full view of a packed theatre audience. Determined to help, he agrees to do whatever it takes to unmask the real killer - but does not count on being recruited to tread the boards in place of the victim. Detective drama, guest starring Amy Sedaris, with Tony Shalhoub.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda gets more than she bargained for when a container holding human remains is found, and resorts to new tactics to enable her team to find the killer. Meanwhile, the detective's niece stirs up trouble. Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda causes conflict with Fritz when she involves her niece in the investigation of a school shooting that left one person dead and another critically injured. Meanwhile, Provenza makes a life-changing decision. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Navy Public Affairs Officer is killed, and when the team takes up the case, both the man's wife and his mistress emerge as potential suspects. Each woman offering a very different take on the chain of events that led to the murder, and the investigators are forced to decide which of the two is telling the truth. Meanwhile, DiNozzo's father comes to the aid of a homeless woman, who makes a surprising claim about his relationship with her. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Tony finds himself in a difficult position when his identity is stolen. Worse yet, multiple fraudsters make use of his status as a special agent to blackmail US senators, and as the chain of events begins to spiral out of control, it is left to the real Dinozzo to bring the perpetrators to justice. Naval crime drama, starring Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agent Carter
programme.desc: Peggy calls upon Howling Commandos squad for backup when she is finally trusted with a mission. But when SSR Chief Dooley sends Agent Thompson with her, her cover could be at risk.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan decides to put an end to Steve's unusually intense friendship with Snot by placing the teen in a witness protection program, and out of the way of his son. Meanwhile, one of Roger's alter-egos begins attacking Jeff.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Lindsey, the Smiths' regular babysitter (guest star Alison Brie), breaks her leg during a soccer match, and Hayley volunteers to look after Steve while Stan and Francine head out on a date. However, when the nerdy teen escapes his sister's attention, he and his friends embark on a quest to gain entry to a big house party, but end up crossing paths with an obsessive meth dealer.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: The Old Man and the Big `C'.
programme.desc: Brian discovers that Carter Pewterschmidt's pharmaceutical company is withholding the cure for cancer from the public to boost its profits. He joins forces with Stewie and plots to reveal the truth, which could change the world for ever. Meanwhile, Quagmire reveals a hair-raising secret of his own.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian uses Stewie's time machine to impress women at bars, but ends up breaking it. The duo try to fix it, but it explodes, leaving them with the shattered remains. As Stewie sets out to rebuild it, he notes that everyday life in Quahog has changed and time is moving faster in reverse - meaning that the intellectual baby could be soon `unborn'.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Francine gets a job at Stan's office, which leaves him unable to flirt with his co-workers - and to make matters even worse, jealousy leads to an awful encounter.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan takes Steve on a father-son bonding trip to the zoo, but it all goes horribly wrong when Steve slips into a gorilla exhibit. Meanwhile, Roger bets Hayley he can become a country singer, and tries to write the most heartbreaking song of all time. Animated comedy, created by Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Quagmire is delighted by the return of his father, a decorated war hero, and eagerly anticipates introducing him to his friends - until he learns the reason for the visit. Meanwhile, Brian has a drunken one-night stand with a mysterious stranger.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Quagmire and Joe embark on a quest to find the source of all dirty jokes - a journey that takes them to Virginia, where they are reunited with former friend Cleveland.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan begins playing golf with Senator Buckingham in a bid to advance in the CIA, but Roger accidentally sells the politician's daughter to a drug lord, which leaves Stan having to choose between his family and his career.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger bets Klaus that he can make Steve popular at school, but none of his plans seem to work - until the high school's in-crowd realise Steve can be their designated driver. Meanwhile, Stan and Francine play pranks on each other.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois causes Peter some distress when she tells him about her dinner date with former boyfriend Ross Fishman, his wife Pam, and their son Ben. Ross brags about their family vacations and that they plan to climb Mount Everest, so Peter decides the Griffins will also make the undertaking. When they return home, he realises his folly and asks Lois to make up an excuse to bail out.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The Griffins receive a letter from the Nielsen Company telling them they have been selected to have their television viewing habits monitored. Tom Tucker comes to the door and asks Peter for some ideas to change the format of the news show, and the ludicrous suggestions include the anchorman shaving off his moustache and wearing a jester hat.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Snot is rejected after professing his love for Hayley, so Roger decides to give him a new love interest - by pretending to be Steve's female cousin. Meanwhile, Stan tries to live like a gentleman of the 1960s, complete with dark suits and dry martinis.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan and Francine argue over how to redecorate their home, and end up splitting the house down the middle and trying to live without each other - but the plan leads to disaster for the whole family.(n)

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones return to reprise their roles in Barry Sonnenfeld's sci-fi action-comedy sequel about the agency that keeps Earth's human inhabitants blissfully oblivious to the pervasive existence of aliens. The film opens as homicidal extraterrestrial Boris the Animal (Jemaine Clement) escaping a 40-year incarceration in a secret high-security prison on the moon. Freshly liberated, Boris sets out for long-brooded-upon revenge on Agent K who shot off his arm when he was captured. Time-travelling to the late 1960s, Boris intends to avoid his amputation, wipe Agent K from history and lead Earth's invasion by his race. Thus Agent J must also head back in time to prevent his friend's younger self from meeting an untimely death and the rest of us from being conquered... With Emma Thompson as Agent O, J and K's boss, and Michael Stuhlbarg as Griffin, J's alien sidekick, who's capable of seeing every possible outcome in every situation(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes falafel with a chipotle tahini dip served in a pitta, chicken and waffles with maple syrup and Bourbon sauce, and a tart with a store-bought shortcut.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a care package to send to Alex, who is away at university, including brownie cookies, homemade cheddar crackers, spicy party mix and crazy chocolate bark.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: The bakers piece together incredible LEGO-themed cakes, with the winner having their cake at the centre of a massive party at LEGO's flagship store.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: The barbecue arena is transformed into a Polynesian paradise for the third week of competition as the contestants are challenged to make a luau pork dish with a tropical fruit side.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver seeks the authentic tastes of Spain in Andalucia. He makes paella for the whole town of Ronda, birthplace of modern bullfighting, and is taught how to cut serrano ham by an award-winning father and son team. As he joins in the local festivities, including carrying a giant statue of the Virgin Mary from church to church, he takes time to cook tomato salad with chorizo, pork chops with Spanish beans, and quail's egg with black pudding.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef looks for things to do with pumpkins other than turning them into traditional Halloween lanterns. Recipes include a roast duck and pumpkin winter salad with Asian dressing, a soup and a lighter snack - squash fairy cakes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves up home-grown winter salad dishes, including a bagna cauda, a herb omelette, and a Japanese-style tuna sashimi with sprouting herb salad and a surprising dressing. Meanwhile, gardener Brian experiments with seeds to demonstrate the full array of colourful, tasty ingredients available in the cold, dark months.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking is in Southern California for two unbelievable backyard blowouts.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Nothing grabs Roger's attention like a raging wood-burning fire, as he witnesses a spectacular feast that everyone can dive into.(n)

programme.title: Bakers vs. Fakers
programme.desc: The bakers have to use beans in campfire s'mores, and Lorraine Pascale, Damiano Carrara and Damaris Phillips judge the contestants on how they handle zucchini in their dishes.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel is called in to help Ricardo, the young owner of Gina's Bistro in Las Vegas.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of The Anchor Bar and Tattoo, Atlanta notices a drop in food and tattoo sales, so the Mystery Diners go undercover to see if the two problems are related.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team helps the owners of Star Cafe and Star Coaches in Atlanta, who are concerned about missing food in their kitchen and a rise in fuel expenses on their tour buses.(n)

programme.desc: Keith Floyd samples the traditional fare of Ulster, cooking beef in Guinness stout with oysters, and paying a visit to the Old Bushmills Distillery. He also takes part in the Taste of Ulster culinary contest, where he faces stiff competition in the form of Northern Ireland's best chefs, and learns the art of making potato bread at the Ulster Folk Museum.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall and Tim Maddams introduce a `leftovers night' at the canteen, turning a range of foods destined for the compost heap into new dishes including gnocchi, fish canapes and puddings made from breadcrumbs. A visit to Portland Young Offender Institution reveals the success of its vegetable-growing programme, and a nursery-school teacher is shown how to bake bread.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: The first two semi-finalists battle it out for a place in finals week. Then the pair return to cook the most important two courses of their careers for Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Tom Kerridge is joined by Angela Hartnett for a discussion on how to make delicious, high-quality food on a tight budget, with the chef and restaurateur pitting her vanilla custard tart against the host's beef and blue cheese risotto. Plus, Oliver Peyton discovers how to spice up his life on the cheap, Kimberley Wilson lifts the lid on how to make great grub from waste food, and drinks expert Joe Wadsack selects the best cut-price wine.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Great Britain
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver concludes his nationwide culinary tour by visiting the west of Scotland, taking in Glasgow's oldest restaurant to discover how haggis is being given a West Indian twist. Fisherman Hector Stewart invites the chef to join him scallop-fishing in the Clyde, and in Striven, he uses Arbroath smokie and rope-grown mussels to create a Scottish version of a classic French dish. He also helps at a pheasant shoot, and uses local game to prepare an ambitious Italian recipe.(n)

programme.title: Floyd on Britain and Ireland

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall finds slugs have started eating his soft cabbages in the garden, so he plans to include them on his menu, and there is disappointment ahead when the chef learns his goat has had a phantom pregnancy. Hugh accepts a fishing-cooking-racing challenge and also visits Portland Young Offenders' Institution, where he learns that part of the inmates' rehabilitation programme involves them growing their own vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: When their regular babysitter can't make it, two suburban parents hire her friend "Anna" (Sarah Bolger) to look after their three children while they enjoy a night out. But when Anna's behavior becomes increasingly unhinged, eldest sibling Jacob (Joshua Rush) grows suspicious and discovers that she's actually an imposter named Emelie who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child. Directed by Michael Thelin, Emelie made its world premiere at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Jackie'
programme.desc: A look at "Jackie," a 2016 drama about former first lady Jacqueline Onassis from her time in the White House to the aftermath of the assassination of her husband, President John F. Kennedy, in 1963. The film stars Natalie Portman, Greta Gerwig and Peter Sarsgaard, and is directed by Pablo Larraín(n)

programme.title: Rails & Ties
programme.desc: Suffering from addiction and depression, Laura Danner (Bonnie Root) drives her car--with her son, Davey (Miles Heizer), inside--onto the railroad tracks, waiting for the train to come and kill them. Davey is able to get out but not save his mother as the train, driven by engineer Tom Stark (Kevin Bacon), crashes into the car(n)

programme.title: Down With Love
programme.desc: Best-selling author Barbara urges girls to throw down their aprons and take control. So sneaky journo Catcher tries to romance her and then show her up(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: When a worldly singer witnesses a mob crime, the police hide her as a nun in a traditional convent where she has trouble fitting in(n)

programme.title: The Golden Compass
programme.desc: Nicole Kidman, Daniel Craig and Dakota Blue Richards star in Chris Weitz's family fantasy-adventure, based on the first book in Philip Pullman's His Dark Materials trilogy. Twelve-year-old orphan Lyra Belacqua lives in an Oxford college, where the staff do their best to push her enquiring mind down conventional educational routes. One day, having sneaked into a private meeting of the college's dons, Lyra learns of mysterious events taking place in the Arctic. Soon after, amid news of mysterious child abductors called the 'Gobblers', her best friend Roger (Ben Walker) vanishes. The fearless Lyra sets off, determined to rescue her playmate. But Lyra's is a parallel universe: one with Victorian-style technology; where people's souls take the visible form of character-suggesting animals; witches and talking, armoured polar bears rule the cold lands of the north; and an organisation called The Magisterium aims to assert its authority. Lyra's journey will prove a dangerous one that uncovers the terrible truth linking the Gobblers and the Arctic phenomenon she heard about in Oxford. Also starring Eva Green, and the voices of Freddie Highmore and Ian McKellan. Sadly, it now seems the following two films in the series are fated not to be made. Even so, this stands as a stirring, thoughtful family adventure that's reasonably true to Pullman's masterpiece(n)

programme.title: Brillo Box (3 ¢ off)
programme.desc: This documentary short traces the history of a sculpture of a Brillo Box by Andy Warhol, from its purchase by a couple in 1969 to its three-million-dollar auction in 2010. Directed by Lisanne Skyler(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.desc: 08-13-2017. No additional information is available(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery stars in this all-action adventure as Allan Quatermain, called out of retirement in Kenya to help the government avert a world war being fomented by master criminal The Phantom. Quatermain gathers together a top team, including Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and The Invisible Man, each with their spectacular skill. From Venice to the wastes of Mongolia, the team face perils and death in their desperate race against time. Stephen Norrington's fantasy, set in an alternative VIctorian world, is frantic fun-filled action from start to finish, with the witty script matching awesome special effects. Edited for violence and language(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: IMF agent Ethan Hunt has been sent on a mission to retrieve and destroy the supply of a genetically created disease called 'Chimera'. His mission is made impossible due to the fact that he is not the only person after samples of the disease. He must also contest with a gang of international terrorists headed by a turned bad former IMF agent who has already managed to steal the cure called 'Bellerophon' and now need 'Chimera' to complete their grand plan of infecting the whole world(n)

programme.title: Room 104
programme.desc: The Knockadoo. A woman seeking salvation is visited by a cult priest who promises to help her transcend the ordinary world for another realm(n)

programme.title: Renaissance Man
programme.desc: Comedy about a former ad executive who is forced by circumstances to take a temporary job teaching bottom-of-the-pile recruits at an Army training camp. Because of their below-average reading and writing skills, the youngsters seem unlikely to be accepted by the Army, but their new teacher turns out to possess a gift for motivating his students(n)

programme.title: Every Brilliant Thing
programme.desc: Jonny Donahoe performs in a one-person play about a man who came of age with a suicidal mother but, at various stages of his life, set about compiling a long list of reasons to live. Filmed at the Barrow Street Theatre in New York City in 2015(n)

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: Meg Ryan, Eva Mendes and Annette Bening head an all-female cast in this comedy drama about a woman whose life begins to unravel when she learns her husband has cheated on her(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators battle a malevolent entity that's haunting a family living in a remote farmhouse in this terrifying tale of the supernatural(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Julia Roberts won the Academy Award® for Best Actress, among five nominations for this stirring, funny and unconventional drama based on real events. Erin Brockovich is in a tight spot following a car accident, though not her fault, her attorney, Ed Masry, fails to land her a settlement. With no money, no job and no prospects, Erin pleads with Ed to hire her at his law firm. There she discovers a cover-up involving contaminated water that's causing devastating illnesses in a local community. By dogged determination and the ability to speak their language, Erin ultimately earns the trust of the locals and signs up more than 600 plaintiffs. Erin and Ed go on to win the largest settlement ever paid in a direct-action lawsuit in U.S. history(n)

programme.title: Resident Evil
programme.desc: Alice leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Alice and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.desc: A stranger steps in to save a pregnant woman from hitman Hertz. He delivers her baby and takes off, pursued by the killer and his henchmen. Supercharged actioner(n)

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: A New York adman deals with the pain of losing a child by writing letters to Time, Death and Love. He is soon visited by representations of the three concepts, and they, along with his close friends, help him return to some semblance of a normal life(n)

programme.title: Stuart Little 2
programme.desc: Stuart must protect a bird from the clutches of the evil Falcon in this sequel(n)

programme.title: The Brothers Bloom
programme.desc: When a con artist decides to go legit his partner-brother tries to convince him to work one last scam to rip off a kooky heiress(n)

programme.title: Vice
programme.desc: A World in Disarray. An examination of the past, present and future of U.S. foreign policy and how post-Cold War alliances have shifted features conversations with diplomats, politicians and scholars, including Council on Foreign Relations president Richard Haass; former secretary of state Condoleezza Rice; former British prime minister Tony Blair; former UN ambassador Samantha Power; political scientist Francis Fukayama; and Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Conn.)(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: Born on the Fourth of July
programme.desc: Paralysed in the Vietnam War, a disillusioned soldier becomes a political activist on the front line of a campaign to support human rights. Based on the biography of patriot, turned political activist, Ron Kovic(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: James Ivory and Ismail Merchant's drama, written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala, stars Kate Hudson, who flies to Paris to visit her pregnant stepsister Naomi Watts. However, her arrival coincides with Watts' husband walking out to live with his Russian mistress. Hudson, forced to stay in Paris, falls in love with the city and begins an ultimately unsatisfying adulterous affair with an older man, coldly observed by her employee Glenn Close, who also had an affair with Lhermitte(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter retreat to what they believe is a secure sanctuary during a brutal home invasion. Newly divorced Meg Altman (Jodie Foster) and her young daughter Sarah (Kristen Stewart) move into a New York brownstone equipped with a panic room; a hidden chamber built as a sanctuary in the event of unwanted "visitors," unaware of how soon they will need it. When their home is the target of a seamless late-night break-in, Meg and Sarah take a stand from the sanctuary of the panic room, playing a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with three intruders: Burnham (Forest Whitaker), Raoul (Dwight Yoakam) and Junior (Jared Leto), during a brutal home invasion(n)

He must also contest with a gang of international terrorists headed by a turned bad former IMF agent who has already managed to steal the cure called 'Bellerophon' and now need 'Chimera' to complete their grand plan of infecting the whole world(n)

programme.title: Room 104
programme.desc: The Knockadoo. A woman seeking salvation is visited by a cult priest who promises to help her transcend the ordinary world for another realm(n)

programme.title: Renaissance Man
programme.desc: Comedy about a former ad executive who is forced by circumstances to take a temporary job teaching bottom-of-the-pile recruits at an Army training camp. Because of their below-average reading and writing skills, the youngsters seem unlikely to be accepted by the Army, but their new teacher turns out to possess a gift for motivating his students(n)

programme.desc: Jonny Donahoe performs in a one-person play about a man who came of age with a suicidal mother but, at various stages of his life, set about compiling a long list of reasons to live. Filmed at the Barrow Street Theatre in New York City in 2015(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: Paranormal investigators battle a malevolent entity that's haunting a family living in a remote farmhouse in this terrifying tale of the supernatural(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Julia Roberts won the Academy Award® for Best Actress, among five nominations for this stirring, funny and unconventional drama based on real events. Erin Brockovich is in a tight spot following a car accident, though not her fault, her attorney, Ed Masry, fails to land her a settlement. With no money, no job and no prospects, Erin pleads with Ed to hire her at his law firm. There she discovers a cover-up involving contaminated water that's causing devastating illnesses in a local community. By dogged determination and the ability to speak their language, Erin ultimately earns the trust of the locals and signs up more than 600 plaintiffs. Erin and Ed go on to win the largest settlement ever paid in a direct-action lawsuit in U.S. history(n)

programme.desc: Alice leads a team of commandos into the multi-national Umbrella Corporation's locked-down bunker, which is controlled by the main computer, The Red Queen. The unit is sealed because of a virus that gassed all the staff but, as Alice and her team discover, the virus has re-animated them. Now, as well as facing the computer's weaponry, they must tackle the living dead to prevent the virus escaping into the outside world. Paul W Anderson's horror thriller is based on the successful computer game(n)

programme.desc: James Ivory and Ismail Merchant's drama, written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala, stars Kate Hudson, who flies to Paris to visit her pregnant stepsister Naomi Watts. However, her arrival coincides with Watts' husband walking out to live with his Russian mistress. Hudson, forced to stay in Paris, falls in love with the city and begins an ultimately unsatisfying adulterous affair with an older man, coldly observed by her employee Glenn Close, who also had an affair with Lhermitte(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A mother and her daughter retreat to what they believe is a secure sanctuary during a brutal home invasion. Newly divorced Meg Altman (Jodie Foster) and her young daughter Sarah (Kristen Stewart) move into a New York brownstone equipped with a panic room; a hidden chamber built as a sanctuary in the event of unwanted "visitors," unaware of how soon they will need it. When their home is the target of a seamless late-night break-in, Meg and Sarah take a stand from the sanctuary of the panic room, playing a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with three intruders: Burnham (Forest Whitaker), Raoul (Dwight Yoakam) and Junior (Jared Leto), during a brutal home invasion(n)

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. But once he gets there, Craig and his cousin have a string of suburban adventures that make his South Central experiences look tame(n)

programme.desc: An estranged family reunite over the holidays for the first time since the death of their matriarch(n)

programme.title: Good Will Hunting
programme.desc: The plot revolves around Will Hunting, who is a janitor at M.I.T. and has a unique gift for mathematics. But irresponsibility and carefree attitude becomes a hindrance towards his progress for which he requires help from a psychologist to find direction in his life(n)

programme.title: Hairspray
programme.desc: Adam Shankman's adaptation of the 2002 musical (itself an adaptation of John Waters' 1988 original movie) stars John Travolta, Queen Latifah and Nikki Blonsky. Teen Tracy Turnblad's regular cultural highlight is a local television music-and-dance programme called The Corny Collins Show. And, like all her friends, she dreams of having a chance to appear on it. However, this is Baltimore and it is 1962 - and Tracy's both overweight and, worse, has liberal attitudes to race relations, which don't sit comfortably with the segregationist views of the show's producer. But, could Tracy's ambitions for not only appearing on the show, but also racially integrating it, receive a fillip when she meets the son of Motormouth Maybelle, host of the monthly 'Negro Day' edition of the show? Also starring John Travolta (in drag and a fat-suit) as Tracy's mum, Christopher Walken, as her dad, and Amanda Bynes, James Marsden, Brittany Snow, Zac Efron and Elijah Kelley; plus cameos from the star of the original movie, Ricki Lake, and its director, John Waters(n)

programme.title: Dragnet

programme.desc: In 1925, an enterprising pro football player convinces America's too-good-to-be-true college football hero to play for his team and keep the league from going under(n)
